listings.description:
Bright, quiet and spacious second floor walk-up Studio Apartment above retail store. With a main room (13' x 18') and high ceiling (8 feet and 4 inches), this hardwood floor Studio has a bathroom with tiled flooring and wainscoting and floor-to-ceiling shower tiles plus remodeled kitchen to one side. The ground-floor was built as a grand theater with reinforced concrete walls and the charming apartments used to house the visiting artists. So, no one lives below or above this 8-unit apartment building. 

One year lease is desirable and one month rent plus equivalent security deposit are needed for move-in. There is resident-dedicated parking rental available, but not included in the rent.

FEATURES:

♦ Large fridge, Italian gas stove, and gas-fired space heater

♦ Bathroom w/new toilet, tiled floor to ceiling (shower stall only- no tub)

♦ spacious closet w/interior light

♦ Re-furbished hardwood floors

♦ Screened new dual-pane windows provide loads of natural light and ventilation

♦ Entrance through San Pablo Ave and through the rear of the building at parking lot

♦ Laundry- room w/shared high-efficiency washer/dryer down the hall

♦ Ample off-street parking as well as secured/gated space for bicycle parking

♦ Water & garbage paid by Owner

♦ Recycling & green waste/composting available

♦ On-site coin-operated laundry room

♦We are investigating installation of high-speed through a third party

♦Off-street parking available at $65 per month under separate agreement

***** Absolutely no smoking *****

LOCATION:

"Very walkable" http://www.walkscore/score/1931-san-pablo-ave-berkeley-ca-94702

♦ Walk score of 88 out of 100

♦ Designated bike lane on Delaware Street

♦ Close to Ohlone Greenway/bike path

♦ Easy ride to Monterey Market or the magnificent new Berkeley Bowl West, regional grocery store.

♦ Walking distance to Grocery Outlet

♦ Close to public transportation:

♦ North Berkeley BART w/casual carpool (10 min. walk)

♦ One block to AC Transit buses 51, 52, 72, 73 & express FS & G to San Francisco

♦ I-80 Freeway

♦ All nearby: Abundant international markets/restaurants, bank, library, post office, Albatross Pub, CafeLeila, Ashkenaz, REI, Cafe Fanny, Lane Splitter, Fourth Street (w/Peets's), Local 123...

This hillside retreat is a one-of-a-kind with open beam ceilings with large beautiful living/dining room/ kitchen open floor plan with spectacular bay views. 

Large master bedroom with private bath, a study complete with built in bookcases and ample storage. There is a washer/dryer and laundry too. 

This flat is comfortably and eclectically furnished. If long term furniture can be removed.

•	Gourmet kitchen with island and bar for entertainment
•	A deck for al fresco dining overlooking the bay
•	Private Garage parking

listings.title: Beautiful Berkeley Hills Retreat

listings.description: Quiet, 3 Bedroom, 2 Bath, single family, one story home in Berkeley Hills, looking east towards Tilden Park. Large deck and lots of natural light, this house has hardwood floors, wood paneling, vaulted ceiling and skylights. It has two separate living areas, one with functional fireplace and separate dining room. There are a few stairs in this open floor plan. It is rented "unfurnished," but does come with washer and dryer in the laundry room. The kitchen has a gas cooktop and electric oven + recent dishwasher. It has a one car garage, and space for another car to park off street. It is located at the end of secluded street, 3 blocks from bus, 3 blocks from Tilden Park. Please E-mail with your phone number for address of open house on Sunday, March 6th from 1-3 PM.
listings.title: 3 BDRM House in Berkeley Hills $3,800

listings.description: Beautiful fully furnished 2 bedroom, 2 bath house (1100 square feet) with living room, dining room, eat in kitchen, small office, laundry, garage, deck and beautiful backyard with grassy area, fruit trees, and vegetable garden. House is light, quiet, and spacious with all amenities including wireless internet. House is fully furnished, rental includes all linens, kitchen equipment, etc. Bedrooms each have their own bathroom; both bedrooms have queen size beds. House is located 1 mile from the UC Berkeley campus in a quiet residential neighborhood of South Berkeley. The house is 3 blocks to the Ashby BART station and walkable to the university, downtown, Elmwood, shops, restaurants, and 2 excellent grocery stores. I own the house, teach at UC Berkeley, and will be away this summer (approximately mid June to mid August, some flexibility of dates possible). I currently have a small dog (who will be with me) and two chickens (who lay fresh eggs daily). The dog will be with me this summer and the chickens can either stay and lay eggs for you, or I can send them to a neighbor. The house has a dog door and I am open to your well-behaved and non destructive small dog. Rent is $3500/month including all utilities and cleaning. 1 month minimum, but prefer someone interested in the full 2 month period. Please include a little information about yourself, your dates, and why you are looking for a rental.

listings.description:
Welcome To Higby

Built In 2015.

A refined living experience in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley. With modern apartments and inviting common areas, Higby creates a place that is both home and a gathering space. Within walking distance to craft breweries, celebrated restaurants, organic markets and cultural highlights, Higby celebrated exploration and adventure. 

Higby offers studio, one-, two- and three-bedroom apartments in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley

Modern building amenities include: 
•	Lobby with lounge seating and TV
•	Courtyard with a bocce ball court
•	Roof deck with a barbecue, fire pit, lounge seating and city views
•	Fitness studio
•	Indoor bike storage and work stand
•	Enclosed residential parking garage

Apartment units feature: 
•	Electric ovens
•	Gas range cooktops
•	Dishwashers
•	Washers and dryers

Higby is designed to operate 25% more efficiently than a code-compliant building. Sustainability highlights contributing to Higby's LEED Gold certification include:
•	Locally sourced and recycle content materials
•	Non-toxic finishes and a building-wide green cleaning program
•	Aggressive construction waste recycling program
•	Native, adaptive plantings to reduce water consumption
•	On-site planters to detain and manage storm water 

So Stretch out. Entertain. Sleep it off. Celebrate pajama day. Declare a lost weekend. Take a conference call from home. Do what you do. Live At Higby.


Office Hours
Monday 9am - 6pm
Tuesday 9am - 6pm
Wednesday 9am - 6pm
Thursday 9am - 6pm
Friday 9am - 6pm
Saturday 10am - 5pm
Sunday 10am - 5pm

3015 SAN PABLO AVE, Berkeley, CA 94702

listings.description:
MODERN AND SPACIOUS WEST END COMMONS LOFT-STYLE TOWNHOME

Building: West End Commons
Neighborhood: Clausen
Bedrooms: 1 BR + Den
Bathrooms: 1 BA
Style: Townhouse
Parking: Deeded
Square Feet: 965
Security Deposit: 1.5 Months
Lease Term: 1 Year
Must Provide Credit Report and Income/Employment Verification, Good Credit Required

This 2-level detached townhouse has no shared walls and no neighbors above or below. High ceiling heights, modern architectural elements, and expansive windows and skylight give this 1 bedroom plus den, 1 bathroom unit, an abundance of natural light.

This loft-style home is spacious, with an open living, dining, and work space. A beautiful open kitchen offers granite countertops, bamboo cabinetry, and top-of-the-line stainless steel Bosch appliances including a refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, gas oven/range, Nest Thermostat, and garbage disposal. The straight staircase leads to the spacious second floor with one bedroom, a large walk-in closet, a den, and a good-sized bathroom with 2 wall-mounted Duravit sinks + custom built vanities, a tiled shower/bathtub, and high-grade lighting fixtures.

Designed by the award-winning firm David Baker + Partners, the individual townhouses at West End Commons combine the functional and stylish aspects of a loft with more traditional aspects of home design. Large open floor plans are paired with well-appointed kitchens and bathrooms as well as more secluded sleeping areas on the upper floors. Each of the townhouses opens on to 1 of 5 lanes. Lined with pavers, lit by streetlights, and landscaped with trees, vines, and grasses, the lanes create an intimate retreat that was inspired by classic urban neighborhoods such as Brooklyn Heights, London's Islington, and Boston's North End. A path leading through shared green space provides an inviting place to wander or meet up with friends, neighbors, or clients.

Located in Oakland's West Clawson neighborhood just 2 blocks south of Emeryville, the development has easy access to all of Emeryville's shops, eateries, grocery stores, and entertainment.

Unit Features:

• 1 bedroom plus den, 1 bathroom bi-level detached townhouse
• 965 sq. ft. 
• High ceilings
• Kitchen features stainless steel Bosch appliances
• Polished concrete floors on first floor, carpet on second floor
• Bathroom with Duravit sinks, subway tiled shower/bathtub, and high-grade lighting fixtures
• Track lighting
• Stackable Bosch washer/dryer in unit
• Central heat and tankless water heater
• Secure parking space right in front of unit
• Pets will be considered on an individual basis

Complex Features:

• Controlled-access intercom/telephone entry system
• Beautifully landscaped including small green park with picnic table
• San Francisco Bay Trail soon to open right in front of complex, connecting you to a variety of hiking, bikin,g and jogging paths that will stretch for 400 miles throughout the Bay Area

listings.description:
1121 - 40th Street Unit 4205, Emeryville
Rental Rates continue rising in SF. Come to sunny Emeryville!!!
Andante Condominiums
1121 40th Street, Emeryville

ABOUT THE UNIT
This unit is located on the 2nd floor facing adaline st and garden. Very well detailed unit with 1 bedroom and 1 full bath. Bright, airy open kitchen and dining room combination with living room area and deck. Excellent exposure to afternoon summer sun. All modern stainless appliance upgrades too. Includes dishwasher, granite countertop, refrigerator, microwave, wood floor, carpet. Parking space included. Approximately 625 square foot unit.

ABOUT THE LOCATION
Andante is located at a premiere corner of Emeryville, at the intersection of San Pablo Ave, 40th and Adeline Streets. Andante is close to Bay Area transportation, Bay Bridge, University of California Berkeley, downtown Oakland, walking distance to many Emeryville's jobs, including Chiron and Pixar Studios. Excellent public transportation to BART, AC Transit to downtown Oakland and San Francisco.

ABOUT THE BUILDING
The Andante is a 125-unit condominium development on 1.83 acres of land in the heart of Emeryville. It is located on the site of the King Midas Card Club, which closed in 1998.
This mixed-use building was designed by HDO Architect Planners, developed by SNK Development and completed in 2005. Amenities include gated secured entry, a fitness center, spa, elevators to all residential levels, private open space/courtyard with seating area and parking for 263 cars. There is 15,000 square feet of ground floor commercial space consisting of restaurants and retail stores.
One- bedroom floor plans at the Andante include sound-controlled walls and floors, granite countertops, laminated wood flooring in the entry and kitchen, ceramic tile flooring in the bathroom, birch and cherry laminated cabinets with satin chrome pulls and an 8-inch-deep dual stainless steel sink. Unit offers upgraded plumbing fixtures, including a Kohler pull-spray kitchen faucet, walk-in closets with shelving, private outdoor space and abundant natural light.

For more information, contact Fred Vaghar at



http://www.andanteemeryville.com for more pics!

* Second Level unit with natural sunlight on both sides of the unit

* Exclusive parking for 1 car in secure garage, secured public parking available for guests.
* Gym and Fitness center
* One year lease preferred
* Internet and all utilities are included.

Welcome To Higby

Built In 2015.

A refined living experience in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley. With modern apartments and inviting common areas, Higby creates a place that is both home and a gathering space. Within walking distance to craft breweries, celebrated restaurants, organic markets and cultural highlights, Higby celebrated exploration and adventure. 

Higby offers studio, one-, two- and three-bedroom apartments in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley

Modern building amenities include: 
•	Lobby with lounge seating and TV
•	Courtyard with a bocce ball court
•	Roof deck with a barbecue, fire pit, lounge seating and city views
•	Fitness studio
•	Indoor bike storage and work stand
•	Enclosed residential parking garage

Apartment units feature: 
•	Electric ovens
•	Gas range cooktops
•	Dishwashers
•	Washers and dryers

Higby is designed to operate 25% more efficiently than a code-compliant building. Sustainability highlights contributing to Higby's LEED Gold certification include:
•	Locally sourced and recycle content materials
•	Non-toxic finishes and a building-wide green cleaning program
•	Aggressive construction waste recycling program
•	Native, adaptive plantings to reduce water consumption
•	On-site planters to detain and manage storm water 

So Stretch out. Entertain. Sleep it off. Celebrate pajama day. Declare a lost weekend. Take a conference call from home. Do what you do. Live At Higby.

This condo is ideal for a single family or 2 individuals. It is a two story unit with the garage and one room (office/art studio) on the first floor and the the main unit on the 2nd floor. It has private backyard and an attached garage.

listings.title: 2B/2B Gateview Condo with Panoramic Bay View (All Utilities included!)

listings.description:
Renters are facing really difficult times right now with very high rent, crazy security deposits, no pets being accepted and landlords want you to have perfect credit and income 3 times or 4 higher than the rent just to allow you to rent their house and pay it off for them. Then they want to increase the rent every time the lease it up and in many cases ask you to move so they can sell the house or move back into it. 

We can send you all of the program information in writing just by sending a request. it includes all of our licensing information. Most people qualify when they have a 580 or higher credit score and can document your income. We get so many people who worry this is a scam but everything we provide you is verifiable through multiple governmental sources.

I have sold homes from Berkeley to Discovery Bay for 27 years. I have managed special financing programs provided by the State and Federal Government that encourage renters to become home owners by providing financing options that don't require perfect credit and in most cases cost less to get into than a rental these days. The financing is 30 year fixed rate and includes property taxes, and all the insurance. Simply put, people who bought homes 15 years ago are still paying the same payment they had originally and you will have the same payment 15 years after you buy the house. Landlords will obviously not be keeping the rent at the same level.

In addition there are tax benefits that you get as a homeowner that help most people save thousands per year in Income Tax. This is the part where many people start to think this is a scam or baloney in general. To help with that we offer two things. I am going to give you ways to confirm the information. In addition I can send you an e mail that has both detailed breakdowns on the programs as well as an e mail that has the properties available with pictures and details. 

The programs that we utilize are FHA, VA, USDA Guaranteed, we also use CHDAP California Housing Down Payment Assistance Program, and CHFA California Housing Finance Agency. These last two programs are state based and provide almost 100% of the down payment you need for the FHA Loan. USDA and VA don't require any down payment. 

This is just 1 of the homes that are available in San Leandro, Hayward, San Lorenzo and Oakland. THERE IS AN E MAIL LIST AVAILABLE THAT GIVES YOU ALL THE DETAILS OF THE PROGRAM AND THE INSTRUCTIONS TO GET QUALIFIED AS WELL AS PICTURES AND DETAILS OF ALL THE HOUSES. PLEASE TEXT OR E MAIL THE REQUEST WITH YOUR E MAIL ADDRESS SO I CAN SEND THESE TO YOU.

This home in San Leandro is 4 bedrooms 2 bathrooms and 1750 square feet. It has a 1 car attached garage and this is all on a lot that is almost 4,000 square feet. 

There are 50 homes available from $2175-$3400 and the homes are 760-2200 square feet with 1-5 bedrooms. There are also Condominiums and Townhomes that have payments ranging from $1625-$2720 per month with 1-4 bedrooms and 680-1700 square feet. These properties will have a separate Home Owners Association due per month of $200-$430 per month. 

The cost to move into one of the homes will typically be $3,000-$5,000. Your first payment will not be due until 30 days after you move in.

To qualify you must have at least
1. A credit score of 580 or higher (credit karma is a place to check if you aren't sure of your credit score)
2. You will need to prove your income with the last 30 days paystubs and the last 2 years tax returns
3. No Bankruptcy in the last 2 years
4. No Short Sale, or Foreclosure in the last 3 years.

Licensed by the California Department of Real Estate Eric Wexelman

I can respond fastest to texts and e mails as I can't answer calls when I am with my other clients.
listings.title: OWN SAN LEANDRO HOME INSTEAD OF RENTING SPECIAL GOVERNMENT FINANCING

listings.description:
Come live in a gorgeous loft in a historic Oakland firehouse offered at $3500. This is a 1000 square foot ground floor loft. The unit comes with a private back yard, a greenhouse, and two parking spaces. This is a unique space, and has been recently refinished. This is not a "cookie cutter" loft in a corporate managed facility. This has the open loft living with added unique features. Your new home comes fully loaded with:

• Two parking spaces
• Water and garbage included
• Private Backyard
• Greenhouse with water and electricity
• Full Size Washer and Dryer
• Remodeled bathroom in all natural stone
• Dishwasher
• Brand new Refrigerator with Ice and water
• Huge bedroom with storage
• 17.5' ceiling
• Original exposed brick
• Newly refinished maple wood floors
• Fresh designer paint 
• New carpet on the stairs and in the bedroom, with cozy padding
• Custom craftsman built-ins
• Additional storage under the staircase
• Wall heater that blasts out hot air quickly
• Windows that flood the place with light in the late morning
• Hard wired fire detector and full sprinkler system
• Large 400 square foot mezzanine bedroom upstairs with a closet
• And much more


The location (94608) is ideally located near restaurants, Ashby BART, IKEA, Pixar, Chiron, and both Berkeley Bowls. There is easy access to Bay Bridge, and several freeways, 80, 580, 980, and 24.

This ground floor loft in a quiet 6-unit building, is part of the original Oakland fire department, which was built in 1892 and converted into lofts in the mid 1990s. This building is currently all owner occupied. This is a very loved building!

I will require an application, credit, references, and confirmation of employment. I would prefer a one year lease. Move in will require first month's rent $3500, security deposit $3500, and an additional rent and deposit if you have pets.

I am available to show the unit almost anytime. You are welcome to call, email, or text for an appointment.

listings.description:
Available March 10 for non smokers only. A bright and sunny end unit , Includes private deck with view! . A large private with panoramic view. features:
- Bed room with a queen size bed, with wi-fi and cable TV, built in desk and a headboard with drawers and shelves. 
- Bathroom wish a shower stall
- Kitchen with a full size fridge. stove, oven, micro wave and toaster, cap board, flat ware, pots and pan, dishes, glasses, cookware
- Large closet with an additional closet for storage a few yards from the entrance door
- Private deck with a view
- Washer/Dryer on site
- A large 'community' back yard/deck with a little garden which gets afternoon sun; a good place for sun-bathing and barbecuing. On-site laundry facility and ample street parking are available. most utilities included. Dogs/Cats are OK if they are quite. Street parking always available for you and your guests.

Pics: http://www.flickr.com/photos/garyluria/ choose Album APT 7, you can also see the house

If you want a modern place may be this one is not for you . . . but, if you yearn for a Victorian sunny habitat with original Victorian (recently refinished) hardwood floors, high ceiling and view . . . 


When you think about it, there is very little competition for Point Richmond's sensation and the deep relaxation that it gives you. My wife and I have been going there from 2002, just to recharge our spirits. A special, different place on the bay.

Located two blocks from Charming downtown Pt Richmond, quiet upscale residential, A short walk to restaurants, shopping, post office, Starbucks etc. For more information about Point Richmond, see http://www.pointrichmond.com/ 

- Please watch a short video about Point Richmond sights: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4vuS8k_vLZA&list=PLhLAMl2nWuUpPJtPq7Y3an2aW_p1DFrbx&index=28

Please see review of 24 Point Richmond Downtown restaurants on yelp http://www.yelp.com/search?find_desc=Restaurants+Downtown&find_loc=Point+Richmond%2C+CA

- "Simple Pleasures" with Patrick Kelly Jones - if you are up for a little walking around for some of the best view of the Bay Area: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v1M8q8kNzhY


Travel, according to Google map, depending on traffic but gives you an idea: Golden Gate, San Francisco 21 minutes, Bay Bridge, San Francisco 20 minutes, University Ave, Berkeley 12 minutes, Richmond BART 8 minutes, Center of San Rafael CA North Bay 13 minutes.

Applicants must be non-smokers and have no criminal record.

The unit has good accessibility to the East Bay, San Francisco and the North Bay with minutes to BART Bay Bridge, HWs 80, 580, 101, Richmond/San Rafael Bridge and Richmond Ferry Terminal. There is one park 2 blocks away and additional two parks and a beach for swimming within walking distance (Approx. 500 yards). The building is surrounded by charming hiking/walking trails with a view of the bay.

The area is considered an upscale quite residential neighborhood. To view pictures: Please log on to You can view a short video at : http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wbpoM9aIkfs 

Directions from Berkeley: Take Richmond Parkway exit; veer to the right; make left to Castro St; another left at the second light still on Castro street; drive straight w/Castro up the hill for about 50 yards or so and turn left to W Richmond Ave. for about 50 yards or so and park at Martina St. 

Please call Gary at

or e-mail back.

listings.title: Spacious 3 bedroom with Amazing Views of The Bay

listings.description:
Video tour:
https://youtu.be/zOY_cLGNBxg

AVAILABLE: April 1 Thru October 31 (could be later) - I'm taking off for a 6 month hike and could live in my camper for a couple months when I get back if you needed to go through December.

FINANCIAL STUFF:
Monthly: 2,495
Deposit: 2,495
Pets: Will accept a small dog, if you watch my small dog (or I'll have my parents watch my dog)
Utilities: All included

SELLING POINTS:
*Furnished
*Newly Renovated, hard wood built in cabinetry in kitchen, living room, and bedroom, and new flooring and painted house and rooms.
*Hot tub access
*Victorian features
*High ceilings
*Bay windows
*Large windows (natural light)
*You can see mt. tam from the dining room.
*Walk 2 BART
*Near major bus lines (51,72, SF commuter)
*Near strawberry creek park (w/café, yoga studio, etc).
*Washing maching (dishes)
*Coin Op washer/dryer in yard (cloths)
*Access to a small shared yard that has a hot-tub.

NEIGHBORHOOD:
Walking to BART, transit, park.
Places to eat (over 10 resturaunts) including Your place Thai and Land Splitters.
Near pubs (acme, albatross. . . and not too far from Missouri lounge)
Places to buy food (several small grocery stores)
Post office, cheese store, german food, chineese food, Pakistani food, Indian, thai, Italian, café. . .. . ... more
Neighbors are a mix of new money and working class families.
There is a youth center that get graffiti on the building at times.
There are million dollar homes.
There are shitty looking apartment buildings.
There are tennis courts, basketball court, volleyball net.
Bank, hardware store.
Basically, the only thing I think you can not buy in the neighborhood is sheets and pillows (use amazon). . . Neighborhood has what you need.

DESCRIPTION OF THE UNIT
As you enter it, you enter into a large Living Room with a gas fireplace with built in hardwood shelving, couches, and a hang out area. To the right is a large bedroom with a bay window and tall ceilings and a closet as well as a built in wood closet. Off the living room is an entrance to the kitchen (which is not huge in size, but has built in cabinetry that is douglas fir, granite countertops, and newly renovated. The kitchen has a dishwasher, cabinets, stove, fridge, microwave etc. . . Off of the kitchen is the Bathroom. This place is in a tri-plex where a neighbor shares the bottom floor and the top floor is another neighbor. Just outside through the backdoor off of the kitchen is a small side-yard that has a Hot-Tub as well as a laundry area and places to put things under the house or stash your bike.

Video tour
https://youtu.be/zOY_cLGNBxg

Can be furnished or unfurnished.

Email me for more info or if you have any questions or would like to arrange a time to see it.

listings.description:
Available March 10 for non smokers only. A bright and sunny end unit , Includes private deck with view! . A large private with panoramic view. features:
- Bed room with a queen size bed, with wi-fi and cable TV, built in desk and a headboard with drawers and shelves. 
- Bathroom wish a shower stall
- Kitchen with a full size fridge. stove, oven, micro wave and toaster, cap board, flat ware, pots and pan, dishes, glasses, cookware
- Large closet with an additional closet for storage a few yards from the entrance door
- Private deck with a view
- Washer/Dryer on site
- A large 'community' back yard/deck with a little garden which gets afternoon sun; a good place for sun-bathing and barbecuing. On-site laundry facility and ample street parking are available. most utilities included. Dogs/Cats are OK if they are quite. Street parking always available for you and your guests.

Pics: http://www.flickr.com/photos/garyluria/ choose Album APT 7, you can also see the house

If you want a modern place may be this one is not for you . . . but, if you yearn for a Victorian sunny habitat with original Victorian (recently refinished) hardwood floors, high ceiling and view . . . 


When you think about it, there is very little competition for Point Richmond's sensation and the deep relaxation that it gives you. My wife and I have been going there from 2002, just to recharge our spirits. A special, different place on the bay.

Located two blocks from Charming downtown Pt Richmond, quiet upscale residential, A short walk to restaurants, shopping, post office, Starbucks etc. For more information about Point Richmond, see http://www.pointrichmond.com/ 

- Please watch a short video about Point Richmond sights: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4vuS8k_vLZA&list=PLhLAMl2nWuUpPJtPq7Y3an2aW_p1DFrbx&index=28

Please see review of 24 Point Richmond Downtown restaurants on yelp http://www.yelp.com/search?find_desc=Restaurants+Downtown&find_loc=Point+Richmond%2C+CA

- "Simple Pleasures" with Patrick Kelly Jones - if you are up for a little walking around for some of the best view of the Bay Area: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v1M8q8kNzhY


Travel, according to Google map, depending on traffic but gives you an idea: Golden Gate, San Francisco 21 minutes, Bay Bridge, San Francisco 20 minutes, University Ave, Berkeley 12 minutes, Richmond BART 8 minutes, Center of San Rafael CA North Bay 13 minutes.

Applicants must be non-smokers and have no criminal record.

The unit has good accessibility to the East Bay, San Francisco and the North Bay with minutes to BART Bay Bridge, HWs 80, 580, 101, Richmond/San Rafael Bridge and Richmond Ferry Terminal. There is one park 2 blocks away and additional two parks and a beach for swimming within walking distance (Approx. 500 yards). The building is surrounded by charming hiking/walking trails with a view of the bay.

The area is considered an upscale quite residential neighborhood. To view pictures: Please log on to You can view a short video at : http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wbpoM9aIkfs 

Directions from Berkeley: Take Richmond Parkway exit; veer to the right; make left to Castro St; another left at the second light still on Castro street; drive straight w/Castro up the hill for about 50 yards or so and turn left to W Richmond Ave. for about 50 yards or so and park at Martina St. 

Please call Gary at

or e-mail back.

listings.description:
This could be your new home! 

California Apartments is a restored 90-year-old building with many long-term residents. The apartments in this vintage building have hardwood floors, tall ceilings, gas stoves and great bathtubs. There is on-site laundry and a community garden. We value our home and we are looking for someone who is friendly and quiet and wants to be a part of our community. 

This unit is available now. Are you our next neighbor?

OPEN HOUSE
Sunday, Feb 28, 10-11am
Call or text me (Dorrit, the on-site manager) if you have any questions.

APARTMENT DESCRIPTION 
*1920s stucco building 
* Hardwood floors 
* Large, walk-in closets (you won't believe the closet space!)
* Eat-in kitchen with gas stove
* Gas oven and gas heat
* 9 foot ceilings 
* Full bathroom with bathtub/shower 
* Double-paned windows
* Owner pays water, hot water, garbage 
* Tenant pays gas, electric & phone 
* One-year lease minimum

LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION
* Four blocks to the North Berkeley BART Station 
* Six blocks to downtown Berkeley and the Berkeley BART
* Five blocks to Trader Joe's
* Two blocks to Ohlone Park and close to the Ohlone Bike Path
* Walking distance to the Berkeley Rep, Freight & Salvage, movie theaters and restaurants
* On a major bus line (the 51)
* Easy access to 4th Street, the freeway, Gourmet Ghetto, and much, much more!

BUILDING AMENITIES 
* Friendly, on-site management 
* Controlled-access entry and intercom system 
* Coin-operated laundry room on premises 
* Parking space available in secured lot for an extra $95 per month 
* Secure bicycle parking (free!) 
* Community Garden! 

APPLICATION PROCESS 
* completed and signed application form 
* proof of income equaling 2 times the monthly rent (check stubs) 
* copy of recent bank statement 
* non-refundable fee of $20 for a credit check 

MOVE-IN COSTS
* First month's rent 
* $2000 deposit 

OTHER INFO
* No pets 
* No smoking
* No handicapped access (Sorry, old building! There is an elevator once you are inside, but there are a few steps at the entrance of the building.) 
* Photos are of similar apartment

listings.description:
Welcome To Higby

Built In 2015.

A refined living experience in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley. With modern apartments and inviting common areas, Higby creates a place that is both home and a gathering space. Within walking distance to craft breweries, celebrated restaurants, organic markets and cultural highlights, Higby celebrated exploration and adventure. 

Higby offers studio, one-, two- and three-bedroom apartments in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley

Modern building amenities include: 
•	Lobby with lounge seating and TV
•	Courtyard with a bocce ball court
•	Roof deck with a barbecue, fire pit, lounge seating and city views
•	Fitness studio
•	Indoor bike storage and work stand
•	Enclosed residential parking garage

Apartment units feature: 
•	Electric ovens
•	Gas range cooktops
•	Dishwashers
•	Washers and dryers

Higby is designed to operate 25% more efficiently than a code-compliant building. Sustainability highlights contributing to Higby's LEED Gold certification include:
•	Locally sourced and recycle content materials
•	Non-toxic finishes and a building-wide green cleaning program
•	Aggressive construction waste recycling program
•	Native, adaptive plantings to reduce water consumption
•	On-site planters to detain and manage storm water 

So Stretch out. Entertain. Sleep it off. Celebrate pajama day. Declare a lost weekend. Take a conference call from home. Do what you do. Live At Higby.

Southshore Gardens Apartments is conveniently located in Alameda, a block from beautiful Crown Memorial Beach and the very popular Alameda Town Centre Shopping Center where you will find almost everything you need. The Transbay Express bus to Mission and First Street in Downtown San Francisco, and buses to Fruitvale BART and the Alameda/Oakland Ferry are feet away. Freeway 880 is easily accessible to San Francisco, Oakland, Berkeley and Fremont.

Community features:
- Beautiful Garden Setting Style

Fire sprinklers in unit.
Community pool, Clubhouse, Gym.

Monthly: 2,495

Pets: Will accept a small dog, if you watch my small dog (or I'll have my parents watch my dog)
Utilities: All included

SELLING POINTS:
*Furnished
*Newly Renovated, hard wood built in cabinetry in kitchen, living room, and bedroom, and new flooring and painted house and rooms.
*Hot tub access
*Victorian features
*High ceilings
*Bay windows
*Large windows (natural light)
*You can see mt. tam from the dining room.
*Walk 2 BART
*Near major bus lines (51,72, SF commuter)
*Near strawberry creek park (w/café, yoga studio, etc).
*Washing maching (dishes)
*Coin Op washer/dryer in yard (cloths)
*Access to a small shared yard that has a hot-tub.

NEIGHBORHOOD:
Walking to BART, transit, park.
Places to eat (over 10 resturaunts) including Your place Thai and Land Splitters.
Near pubs (acme, albatross. . . and not too far from Missouri lounge)
Places to buy food (several small grocery stores)
Post office, cheese store, german food, chineese food, Pakistani food, Indian, thai, Italian, café. . .. . ... more
Neighbors are a mix of new money and working class families.
There is a youth center that get graffiti on the building at times.
There are million dollar homes.
There are shitty looking apartment buildings.
There are tennis courts, basketball court, volleyball net.
Bank, hardware store.
Basically, the only thing I think you can not buy in the neighborhood is sheets and pillows (use amazon). . . Neighborhood has what you need.

DESCRIPTION OF THE UNIT
As you enter it, you enter into a large Living Room with a gas fireplace with built in hardwood shelving, couches, and a hang out area. To the right is a large bedroom with a bay window and tall ceilings and a closet as well as a built in wood closet. Off the living room is an entrance to the kitchen (which is not huge in size, but has built in cabinetry that is douglas fir, granite countertops, and newly renovated. The kitchen has a dishwasher, cabinets, stove, fridge, microwave etc. . . Off of the kitchen is the Bathroom. This place is in a tri-plex where a neighbor shares the bottom floor and the top floor is another neighbor. Just outside through the backdoor off of the kitchen is a small side-yard that has a Hot-Tub as well as a laundry area and places to put things under the house or stash your bike.

Email me for more info or if you have any questions or would like to arrange a time to see it.

listings.title: Bright 2 bedroom, 3-Blocks from Bart

listings.description:
Nature is whispering in your ears. A rare woodland retreat! Don't miss this rare opportunity to reside in a truly classic Montclair home!

Dog ok up to 25lbs. Pet insurance required. Owner will approve breed, not agent. References needed (from pet hospital too).

Brief Description:
Discover this inspiring Mediterranean style Montclair home located high in the prestigious Montclair District in the Oakland Hills. Built in 1993. Discover this inspiring Mediterranean style Montclair home located high in the prestigious Montclair District in the Oakland Hills. Built in 1993, this comfortable two-story in-law unit is one bedroom, one bath with private entrance wonderful garden area and a view looking directly to San Francisco. Gardens private tranquil forested setting.

While this house offers the one-of-a-kind charm of an authentic Mediterranean style Montclair home -- complete with authentic architectural details -- modern updates throughout balance ease of living for today's lifestyle. The layout and functionality are perfect: tall vaulted entry, Spanish tile floors and carpeting, a large living room with high ceiling and corner room windows, space-saver, modern kitchen, provide excellent flow throughout the living areas across two levels. Sunny second floor bedroom and large bath on the the main level. 
The upstairs bedroom with private deck and bay view is accessible through a spiral staircase!

Old style plaster interior walls give this home a cozy woodland feel. There is a sophisticated warmth about this in-law apartment.

Owner pays utilities, trash and gardening. Application fee is $30 per adult (18+). Credit score must be 700 plus.

Neighborhood and Vicinity:
Yes, location is everything. The East Bay Regional Parks Lake Temescal open space area is within walking distance. The Hills Swim and Tennis Club are moments away on Thornhill Drive. Shopping and dining in Montclair Village is just down Mountain Blvd. You won't want to miss nearby Montclair Village, only a mile away, with its abundance of restaurants, boutique stores, design galleries, ice cream and coffee shops. There are bakeries, retail shopping, two supermarkets, and a host of other chow providers very nearby as well.

Nearby, the Temescal and Tilden Regional Recreation areas offer hiking and swimming. Enjoy Lake Temescal with its sweet beach, walking paths and fishing spots. We are within minutes of many other amazing hiking, biking, and riding trails and parks.

This home is less than five miles from UC Berkeley. PIXAR, Bayer, Kaiser Hospital, Summitt Hospital and Alta Bates Hospital are all within an easy drive. Downtown Berkeley and Oakland are 10-15 minutes close by. There is excellent transit availability on Broadway Terrace and Mountain Blvd. Commuters will appreciate the easy access to the Rockridge BART station.

This location is also ideal if you'd like to visit the Oakland Rose Garden or the Sculpture Gardens Jack London Square, the University of California, Berkeley, or Silicon Valley. Downtown Oakland has some of the best restaurants in California, not to mention a downtown lake, complete with gondolas and a running path.

For baseball fans, the SF Giants are 25 minutes away by car, BART, or Ferry. The Ferry drops you off at Center Field before the game and picks you up 20 min. after. The Oakland Coliseum, home of the fabulous Oakland Athletics, is 20 min away by car or BART. Street parking is free and ample.

Getting Around:
San Francisco is only 20 minutes away, Muir Woods a quick 45 minute drive, and the wineries of Napa and Sonoma are an hour away. We are 20 minutes from Oakland airport and 35 minutes from SFO. BART, with a station just 1.5 miles away, goes into downtown Oakland and San Francisco, as well as to both airports. The ferry system, a more scenic mode of transportation, goes from Jack London Square to San Francisco, Marin, or Angel Island. From the Ferry Station in SF, you can get a boat to Alcatraz Island, one of the most famous prisons in the world. It makes for a wonderful day trip.
Don't miss this rare opportunity to reside in a truly classic Montclair home!

Highlights
•	Private woodland retreat in the Montclair hills.
•	Available partly furnished
•	Located on a large tranquil forested lot.
•	Spanish tile and carpet throughout.
•	Large sunny living room with corner garden view windows.
•	One bedroom upstairs via spiral staircase. 1 bath on main level.
•	Kitchen with tile floor, modern cabinetry, solid countertop, gas range top, microwave, refrigerator, stainless sink, modern lighting.
•	Abundance of natural light.
•	Soft tone neutral paint colors.
•	Excellent off-street parking.
•	Utilities paid by owner, gardening and garbage paid by owner
•	Asking rent $2200 monthly
•	Security deposit $2500
• No pets/animals
• Contact broker/property mgr, Frank Hennefer,

BRE 00852682
• Shown by appt only. Please Do Not Disturb Occupants.

listings.description:
https://www.google.com/maps/d/viewer?mid=zaby4TO8AqUY.kK5QINPCDDg4&usp=sharing

when we were looking for a place we initially wanted to be on a main street.. 

piedmont, grand, college (both berkeley and oakland), bay st, fourth st, university, you get the idea. . . 

but we couldn't figure out which... 
and we didn't know what that would mean for parking... 
and we weren't sure how close that would put us to highways if we need to leave town :) 

so... 
we wrote down every place we like in the east bay... 
Including. . . 

http://www.4thstreetshop.com/ 
shopping outdoors 
http://www.sfgate.com/traveler/guide/eastbay/neighborhoods/piedmont.shtml 
restaurants & independent movies 
http://www.baystreetemeryville.com/ 
commercial/mall like & mainstream movies 
http://www.shattuckshop.com/ 
decent coffee shops and various ethnic foods 
http://www.sfgate.com/traveler/guide/eastbay/neighborhoods/grand.shtml 
a lake, a farmers market, a theatre, delis, bakeries, and both starbucks for her, petes for me 
http://www.shopparkstreet.com/ 
a little further out in alameda, a longer stretch that used to be trees and is now everything else 
http://www.oaklandchinatownchamber.org/visitor/about_chinatown.html 
smaller, but more authentic then sf chinatown 
http://jacklondonsquare.com/ 
shopping, dining, jazz, waterfront 

and PUT IT ON A MAP... Just like this... 
https://www.google.com/maps/d/viewer?mid=zaby4TO8AqUY.kK5QINPCDDg4&usp=sharing

and then we picked the center of it all... 
ADELINE ST, EMERYVILLE 

And 80, 580, 880, 980, 24, 13, etc are all very very accessible... 

so now we're close to everything we want, 
we can eat, play, sleep, read a book, see a movie, go to the park, go to berkeley bowl, go to university of berkeley, etc. 
we can get on a highway that takes us to SF in 10 minutes, 
we can leave behind the car at the ashby bart if we want to be good to the environment, 
we have a place to park (secured on our lot) 
we have a washer and dryer (secured - no coins) 
we have internet access 
we have utilities 


FAQ 

availability - place just got posted, is available, but we got more responds then we expected, so pardon the generic reply: 

showing the unit - we will look at applications this week, show the unit the week of 01/11. earliest move-in will be 02/01, though 03/01 is preferable.

kids - ok to have kids, there are schools, and a childrens hospital in the area 

supermarkets - plenty in the area... from shop n save, to safeway, to berkeley bowl, to whole foods 

layout - see picture below 

price - there's a 1BR 4 blocks away renting for 2500 - in fact, looking at 3900 Adeline, which is closer to best buy/ikea and highway noise, but further from UC Berkeley, Oakland down to Alameda, and you'll see STUDIOs renting for $1775 (not to mention parking) - look at the pricing in all of emeryville, and you find that it's already priced to rent. the market is hot, but we want a long term tenant so it's priced fairly.

those who travel alot - you can leave your car and disappear whenever you'd like, just give us a notice so we don't worry about you 

check scams - no interest in cashing checks ahead of time and giving you the difference. 

delayed rental - looking to rent asap. not sure we could guarantee the place for anything more than a month delay, and only to the right candidate, with a deposit, and the other general warnings 

out of towners - no problem if you're relocating, and feel free to ask questions... again, if there's a delay in move, please make sure to communicate it early and see the above line 

move in costs - unless you're a terrible person, with terrible credit, and a terrible attitude, first+last month will be sufficient. 

DISHWASHER - YES, UPDATING THE POST TO REFLECT THAT TOO... THANKS FOR REMINDING US. 

anything else that was neglected in the posting - feel free to ask

This unit is under 700 sqft. We had an earlier posting for a similar (slightly smaller) property down the street. That unit was rented out one day after posting and went for over asking, 6 months paid in advance. This location and price point are not going to be matched. We are looking for good long term tenants. Please allow 48 hours for responses.

listings.description:
Welcome To Higby

Built In 2015.

A refined living experience in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley. With modern apartments and inviting common areas, Higby creates a place that is both home and a gathering space. Within walking distance to craft breweries, celebrated restaurants, organic markets and cultural highlights, Higby celebrated exploration and adventure. 

Higby offers studio, one-, two- and three-bedroom apartments in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley

Modern building amenities include: 
•	Lobby with lounge seating and TV
•	Courtyard with a bocce ball court
•	Roof deck with a barbecue, fire pit, lounge seating and city views
•	Fitness studio
•	Indoor bike storage and work stand
•	Enclosed residential parking garage

Apartment units feature: 
•	Electric ovens
•	Gas range cooktops
•	Dishwashers
•	Washers and dryers

Higby is designed to operate 25% more efficiently than a code-compliant building. Sustainability highlights contributing to Higby's LEED Gold certification include:
•	Locally sourced and recycle content materials
•	Non-toxic finishes and a building-wide green cleaning program
•	Aggressive construction waste recycling program
•	Native, adaptive plantings to reduce water consumption
•	On-site planters to detain and manage storm water 

So Stretch out. Entertain. Sleep it off. Celebrate pajama day. Declare a lost weekend. Take a conference call from home. Do what you do. Live At Higby.

Hi:
We are thinking of moving into a bigger place in March. 
This apartment unit is in Hillside Village (Shattuck Ave and Delaware street), it's on the 4th floor (total of 5), and is facing east, so facing the campus which is quieter compare to west facing units that are facing Shattuck Ave. 
You can go to www.hillsidevillageberkeley.com for more details about the apartment complex.
Management is responsive, and the apartment complex is very convenient to BART, the university, and many great restaurants and cafe. It's also great to have the leasing office to handle your package for you when you are not home. The lease can start in March, and ends on July 31st, 2016. You can then decide if you want to renew it or not.

Please let me know if you are interested, or if you want to see more photos. It will be unfurnished so you will need your own furnitures. Thanks

listings.title: 2 Bed 1 Bath- Unit 309

listings.description:
Premier living in Richmond's Hilltop district 

San Marcos Apartments in Richmond, California offers convenience so you can focus on fun. Park your vehicle in the comfort of your own private garage, then head inside and spend an evening cozying up next to the fireplace. Whatever your ideal furniture arrangement might be, we offer numerous floor plans in our one- and two-bedroom apartments that are sure to complement your interior design savvy. Controlled, gated access and night patrol means you sleep soundly, and our on-site maintenance team is available 24/7 for all of those "Uh-oh!" moments. Feeling stressed? Take advantage of our fitness center and sports courts for that calorie burn, or stroll down beautifully manicured pathways with your pooch to get some fresh air (yes, of course, these Richmond apartments are pet friendly).

Our location in Richmond's Hilltop neighborhood puts you near tons of great places to shop and dine. Head to the Vista del Mar Village Shopping Center to pick up a latte at Starbucks, or shop to your heart's content at the Hilltop Mall, home to staples like Macy's and JC Penny as well as a Wal-Mart. Fresh air abounds at nearby Hilltop Lake Park, and we are also minutes away from the Richmond Country Club and Pointe Pinole Regional Shoreline. Need to get out of Richmond? Hop on I-80 for an easy drive to other cities in the Bay Area. If you don't feel like wasting gas, we are also near bus lines and a few miles from the Richmond Transit Station.

Life should be enjoyed, and here at San Marcos Apartments you will have plenty of opportunity to do just that.

listings.title: Lovely Neighborhood, Raised Beds, Mature Neighbors, Peace & Quiet

listings.description:
Welcome To Higby

Built In 2015.

A refined living experience in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley. With modern apartments and inviting common areas, Higby creates a place that is both home and a gathering space. Within walking distance to craft breweries, celebrated restaurants, organic markets and cultural highlights, Higby celebrated exploration and adventure. 

Higby offers studio, one-, two- and three-bedroom apartments in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley

Modern building amenities include: 
•	Lobby with lounge seating and TV
•	Courtyard with a bocce ball court
•	Roof deck with a barbecue, fire pit, lounge seating and city views
•	Fitness studio
•	Indoor bike storage and work stand
•	Enclosed residential parking garage

Apartment units feature: 
•	Electric ovens
•	Gas range cooktops
•	Dishwashers
•	Washers and dryers

Higby is designed to operate 25% more efficiently than a code-compliant building. Sustainability highlights contributing to Higby's LEED Gold certification include:
•	Locally sourced and recycle content materials
•	Non-toxic finishes and a building-wide green cleaning program
•	Aggressive construction waste recycling program
•	Native, adaptive plantings to reduce water consumption
•	On-site planters to detain and manage storm water 

So Stretch out. Entertain. Sleep it off. Celebrate pajama day. Declare a lost weekend. Take a conference call from home. Do what you do. Live At Higby.


Office Hours
Monday 9am - 6pm
Tuesday 9am - 6pm
Wednesday 9am - 6pm
Thursday 9am - 6pm
Friday 9am - 6pm
Saturday 10am - 5pm
Sunday 10am - 5pm

3015 SAN PABLO AVE, Berkeley, CA 94702

Contact us



www.livehigby.com

listings.description:
We need someone to take over our lease for the summer. From mid-may (we are flexible on moving date) to 8th of August.

The apartment has 2-bedrooms, 1 bathroom and is fully furnished. It includes 4 beds, dressers, a sofa, chairs, tables and kitchen equipment. Laundry room is located at each floor. The building has a sweet rooftop. Movie of apt: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S9ZchX03UWI 

The apartment is at 2110 Haste Street (Fine Arts Building) close to Shattuck. 5-10 minutes walk from Downtown Berkeley Bart station and 5-10 minutes walk to campus.

The rent is 3280 dollars per month from mid-may to 8th August. WIFI and cable is included. Other utilities such as water, sewer, garbage, gas and PGE is about 130 dollars each month. Deposit is 600 dollars (in total for the apartment).

We have an option to extend the contract for one more year from August 2016 to August 2017. The rent from august 2016 will be 3570 per month (this rent is also including parking spot (in the garage) and extra storage place.

Just to clarify, we are all moving out in May and the apartment fits 4 people. We could probably throw our furniture in for free.

We will be happy to answer any questions you may have. Please contact us in either telephone or email.

Check out this charming, garden cottage! The unit is one-bedroom, one, spacious bathroom, has plenty of closet space, kitchen, living room, and a spacious back porch area
Located in West Berkeley, behind a duplex, this cottage stands on it its own, and features recently carpeted floors, plenty of counter space, and a lovely view of your friendly, front neighbor's garden. It is a convenient, five minute walk from Berkeley Bowl West (groceries) and a ten minute bike ride to Ashby BART. Nearby bus lines are the 72 San Pablo, the Transbay Z line, the 82Z, and the 49. It is also located within walking distance of a number of excellent restaurants and cafes, like Paisan, Mint Leaf, Anjalee, 100 Grayson and Café Trieste. The apartment is very secure (it is accessed through a locking side-gate), sunny, full of light, acoustic music-friendly, full of beautiful woodwork, and ready to rent starting March 7th. Appliances included are a refrigerator, range, wall heater, and bathroom wall heater. Water and Garbage are included. Deposit is $2,100, plus last month's rent. Rent is $2,100 a month, one-year lease required. No Section 8, no pets, no smoking. For more information or to book a viewing, e-mail, or call (please don't text--texts will not be received.)

listings.description:
Welcome To Higby

Built In 2015.

A refined living experience in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley. With modern apartments and inviting common areas, Higby creates a place that is both home and a gathering space. Within walking distance to craft breweries, celebrated restaurants, organic markets and cultural highlights, Higby celebrated exploration and adventure. 

Higby offers studio, one-, two- and three-bedroom apartments in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley

Modern building amenities include: 
•	Lobby with lounge seating and TV
•	Courtyard with a bocce ball court
•	Roof deck with a barbecue, fire pit, lounge seating and city views
•	Fitness studio
•	Indoor bike storage and work stand
•	Enclosed residential parking garage

Apartment units feature: 
•	Electric ovens
•	Gas range cooktops
•	Dishwashers
•	Washers and dryers

Higby is designed to operate 25% more efficiently than a code-compliant building. Sustainability highlights contributing to Higby's LEED Gold certification include:
•	Locally sourced and recycle content materials
•	Non-toxic finishes and a building-wide green cleaning program
•	Aggressive construction waste recycling program
•	Native, adaptive plantings to reduce water consumption
•	On-site planters to detain and manage storm water 

So Stretch out. Entertain. Sleep it off. Celebrate pajama day. Declare a lost weekend. Take a conference call from home. Do what you do. Live At Higby.

This peaceful, charming, vintage home constructed in 1939 is located in North Berkeley. The one story duplex features windows on all sides with miniblinds throughout. Working wood burnung fireplace. Wood ceiling in living room. Pristine oak hardwood flooring in living room, hall, bedrooms and closets. Tile floors in kitchen, laundry room and bathroom. Porcelain tile in barthroom and on kitchen countertops. Newly repainted interior. Kitchen with gas stove and Maytag refrigerator. Maytag washer and dryer in laundry room. Bathroom has a tub with shower, pedestal sink. Gas heat.
Offstreet driveway parking.
Cats welcome; no dogs please.

Terms:
$3250 per month
$4000 security deposit
Tenant pays water and PG&E utility bills.

Please reply if interested in viewing and include information on who would potentially be living in the unit.

Available now.
listings.title: QUIET, SPACIOUS NORTH BERKELEY DUPLEX

listings.description:
Library Gardens' Berkeley apartments feature modern appointments including:

-Gourmet Kitchens with Breakfast Bars, Double-Basin Sinks, Garbage Disposals, 
and GE Appliances including Built-in Microwaves, Full-Size Refrigerators, 
and Full-Size Dishwashers
-Pre-wired for Cable, Internet Service, and Multiple Phone Lines in Each Residence
-Spacious Closets with European-Style Shelving
-Lofty 10-Foot Ceilings
-Roommate-Friendly Floor Plans -- Perfect for Students
-Environmentally-Friendly Paint, Adhesives and Carpets for Better Indoor Air Quality

Library Gardens, Berkeley's premier apartment community, features an extensive array of amenities:

-24-Hour Laundry Care Centers on Each Floor 
-Wireless Connection throughout Community 
-Small Dogs and Cats Welcome 
-Bike Racks and Lockers 
-Monthly On-Site Parking Available 
-VIP Parking for Hybrids and Alternative Fuel Vehicles 
-Plentiful Guest Parking 
-Complimentary Package Acceptance Service 
-Copy and Fax Service 
-Private Access Entry 
-Verdant Private Courtyards and Terraces

Library Gardens offers modern, beautiful Berkeley apartments in the heart of vibrant downtown Berkeley:

-One block to UC Berkeley Campus
-One block to public transport (BART, AC Transit)
-Steps to restaurants, cafes, bookstores and shopping
-Over 20 movie screens within 1/2 block, including fine art film venues 
-Adjacent to Berkeley's Public Library, YMCA and the Habitot Children's Museum 

*Prices are subject to change daily
*Furniture is not included only high speed internet,cable and trash

listings.description: "MOVE IN INCENTIVE: $850 discount on first month's rent if leased and moved in by February 7th!Welcome to your next home. This two bed, one bath apartment is an urban garden sanctuary in West Berkeley. Nestled among a tree lined street, the unit is in a beautiful neighborhood. Within walking distance to Aquatic Park, the 4th Street shops, Berkeley Bowl, and much more, this location has everything you need within minutes. It is also conveniently close to buses and Amtrak, and has easy access to Hwy 580/80. The property adds an extra level of privacy with a high fence and front gate. After stepping inside, the fresh appearance gives a sense of light and openness. The kitchen features everything you'll need to cook at home. The bedrooms are bright and comfortable as well. NOTE: Furniture in images not included. Rental will be unfurnished."

listings.description:
**Spacious 5-bedroom, 2 bathroom house, 3 blocks from campus**

Please check out this YouTube.com video for a virtual tour of this house. . .
https://youtu.be/HNYTc_rsnP4

This house will be available June 1st. 

This is a well-loved, SPACIOUS 5-bedroom-plus home. It comes with, very large common areas, beautiful hardwood floors, huge windows, 2 bathrooms and a lovely private yard!

Bedroom Features;
>TWO Master bedrooms (one with double doors), one upstairs & one downstairs 
>Large closets space
>Five individual bedrooms
>Lots of natural light
>Each bedroom can comfortably fit a queen-sized bed

House Features;
>One impressive walk-in Living Room
>One "mud room" -- contains washer & dryer
>Private front yard

Location features;
>4 blocks from downtown Berkeley BART
>3 blocks from campus
>Less than 2 blocks from major AC transit stops, including the 1, 51, 18, and F transbay

Again, if you have a group of housemates interested in leasing this whole house for one year, then please reply back to this craigslist posting. Don't forget to include your phone and email address so we can contact you to schedule a showing.


******If you are interested in viewing the apartment, please reply to this craigslist post and email us your real email address and put these words in the subject line: 
"2222 Haste: REALLY INTERESTED"
listings.title: 5 bedroom house 2 blocks from campus

listings.description:
Welcome To Higby

Built In 2015.

A refined living experience in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley. With modern apartments and inviting common areas, Higby creates a place that is both home and a gathering space. Within walking distance to craft breweries, celebrated restaurants, organic markets and cultural highlights, Higby celebrated exploration and adventure. 

Higby offers studio, one-, two- and three-bedroom apartments in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley

Modern building amenities include: 
•	Lobby with lounge seating and TV
•	Courtyard with a bocce ball court
•	Roof deck with a barbecue, fire pit, lounge seating and city views
•	Fitness studio
•	Indoor bike storage and work stand
•	Enclosed residential parking garage

Apartment units feature: 
•	Electric ovens
•	Gas range cooktops
•	Dishwashers
•	Washers and dryers

Higby is designed to operate 25% more efficiently than a code-compliant building. Sustainability highlights contributing to Higby's LEED Gold certification include:
•	Locally sourced and recycle content materials
•	Non-toxic finishes and a building-wide green cleaning program
•	Aggressive construction waste recycling program
•	Native, adaptive plantings to reduce water consumption
•	On-site planters to detain and manage storm water 

So Stretch out. Entertain. Sleep it off. Celebrate pajama day. Declare a lost weekend. Take a conference call from home. Do what you do. Live At Higby.


Office Hours
Monday 9am - 6pm
Tuesday 9am - 6pm
Wednesday 9am - 6pm
Thursday 9am - 6pm
Friday 9am - 6pm
Saturday 10am - 5pm
Sunday 10am - 5pm

3015 SAN PABLO AVE, Berkeley, CA 94702

Contact us



www.livehigby.com
listings.title: Live Green, Live Better, Live in Luxury, Live Higby

Spacious 2bd/1ba located just a few blocks from the Cal campus & one block to Shattuck Ave/Downtown. Both bedrooms are roomy with large double door closets for ample storage space. The hallway has an additional two closets for extra storage. Full sized kitchen with updated appliances and granite counters plus breakfast bar. listings.description:
**Showings Available by Appointment** 


Large 2 bedroom in beautiful classic Berkeley building near Gourmet Ghetto available March 7th

1332 Shattuck Ave, Berkeley, CA 94709

$3,200/mo 

KEY FEATURES
Year Built: 1924
Sq Footage: Over 900 sqft.
Bedrooms: 2 Bed
Bathrooms: 1 Bath
Parking: Carport spot available for $100 a month
Lease Duration: 1 Year
Deposit: $3,200
Pets Policy: Cats OK
Laundry: Coin Operated
Floor: 4th
Property Type: Apartment

DESCRIPTION

1332 Shattuck Avenue, Berkeley CA 94709 


The property is a beautiful eighteen unit apartment building located in the highly desirable North Berkeley Neighborhood, just a few short blocks north of the Cal campus. The four story property was constructed in 1924 and still retains the charm of the period with wood floors, high ceilings, and spacious living quarters. listings.title: Great apartment near downtown Berkeley/Gourmet Ghetto.

listings.description:
I am looking for one mature and reliable person to live in my adorable studio. There is a private bathroom, pull out love seat, a natural gas fire pit in the yard, a storage shed, a gas grill, and a few fruit trees. There is a kitchenette with a nice double induction burner, blender/food processor, induction kettle, microwave, convection oven, plenty of storage space,and mini-fridge. The room is fully furnished with queen bed, pillows, desk and chair, heater, sheets, towels, and kitchen supplies (including some staples like spices, rice, four, oil, etc). I will even consider letting you use my bike if you are trustworthy. The place is really cute with lots of light. The neighborhood is very quiet. There is a great park 2 blocks away and many groceries, coffee shops, laundromats, bars, and restaurants within walking distance. There is a bus at the end of the street that gets you right onto campus within 15 minutes or you can bike there in 15 minutes. You have a pretty great view of the city from the top of the driveway as this neighborhood is up on a hill. Landlord is fine with guests as long as you let her know.

The move in/out dates are semi-negotiable but you would have to be out by August 21st at the latest. $500 deposit (refundable assuming no damage). Rent includes all utilities. No pets - sorry. 

There are a few odd things about the place. The cottage is a mother-in-law suite - as in: it is in the backyard of the main house where the landlord and her 2 children live. The bathroom that goes with the cottage is connected to the back of the main house. It is a private bathroom with only one entrance from the outside which is about ten steps outside the front door of the cottage. So you have to walk outside to get to the bathroom, but not far, and it is your bathroom alone. Also - there is no sink in the studio so you have to do dishes in the bathroom sink. I have a dish drainer setup in the bathroom and the sink is not prohibitively small. While this is a strange setup, I have never had issues with it at all.

The landlord will want to meet you but other than that you won't interact with her much. You basically have 100% privacy in the unit and backyard and it is nice and quiet.

- All new paint throughout

- Laundry facilities on site

- Range & refrigerator included



One year lease

$1,950 security deposit

Sorry, no pets
No subletting
Application requirements are at the bottom of the ad


The next showings will be at:
1:00pm sharp on Saturday, February 27th and
1:00pm sharp on Sunday, February 28thAt 2491 Ellsworth Street in Berkeley 
It's a locking building, so I will meet you out front and take you up at the showing time. Anyone who arrives after that will unfortunately miss the showing


Applications are paper or pdf only, available at the end of the viewing.
All applicants over 18 need to fill out an application and provide a $40 application fee in cashier's check or money order payable to Picardo Arms Apartments.There is a $100 holding deposit. We only process one person's or one set of roommates' applications at a time. The deposit takes the apartment off the market and is refundable for up to three business days. After that, it's non-refundable. Bring all of your documents at the same time, and we process your application well within the three days. If you pass, the deposit becomes the first $100 of your security deposit. If you don't pass, even if your application is processed after the three business days, we return the $100 to you. The $40 application fees are non-refundable once the applications are processed regardless of the result.Applicants must show combined income of at least 3x the rent amount per month gross (pre-tax) and good credit based in the U.S. If credit and income aren't met (and the applicant does not have overly poor credit) then a cosigner may be used. A cosigner applies in the same way with another $40 application fee. A copy of a passport or driver's license and proof of income is required for each application. Proof of income can be in the form of two recent pay stubs, social security checks, pension, trust fund or support checks, or tax returns.
Note for new international residents: if you don't have a credit history in the U.S. because of your national status, you may be exempt from the credit requirement; however, you will still need to meet the income requirement and will be required to pay an increased security desposit.
All fees and charges, including move in fees, must be in the form of cashier's check or money order, payable to Picardo Arms. Once you are a tenant, from your 2nd month onward, you may pay by personal check.

Location: 555 Pierce Street #1336, Albany CA in Gateway Hi-Rise Condominium

This condo is a spacious, clean and quiet 2br 2ba apartment in 24/7 security gated Gateview complex. It has an open floor layout for the dining area and living room. Master suite with full bathroom, 2nd bedroom & full bathroom in hallway. 1,150 square foot of living space. Community features: elevator, secured entry, controlled access, swimming pool, fitness center, tennis courts, gated garage parking, and courtyard with great San Francisco & Golden Gate view.

Short walking distance to Pacific East Mall with Ranch 99 supermarket, restaurants, & many other stores. Short drive to Bart, Solano Ave, Albertson's, Trader Joe's, CVS, Oaks Theater, 24 Hour Fitness, Tokyo Fish Market, Target, COSTCO and many more. AC Transit Bus stops step away from the front of the complex. Carpool pick up spot to SF is in front of the plaza. Just a few miles to UC Berkeley. 

Excellent Top Rated Public Schools: Albany High (9 out of 10), Albany Middle (9 out of 10), Cornell Elementary (9 out of 10)

Fabulous Solano Avenue business district begins in Albany and ends in North Berkeley. Albany
still has no parking meters!!! (This is how Berkeley once was...)

Info: 2 bed 2 bath apartment, 1,150 sf of living space and patio with park mountain view - one assigned parking - washer/dryer in building - tenant pays electricity - owner covers water, cable TV and garbage. Move in costs: 1st month's rent + security deposit ($3000) You will need a current credit report - last 2 months of pay stubs and bank statement - must have stable income. 

A brief note about your situation may help kick-start the process. An application is available by email if you feel like saving some time, but is optional until applying. Applicants are selected on a first-come, first-qualified basis after application processing. Please email to schedule a showing.
Thank you for your interest.

listings.description:
Just remodeled 1 bed + 1 bath + Full Kitchen + Dining room + Living room + Private Patio + 1 Assigned Secure Covered Parking

New paint, new carpet, updated kitchen, mirror closets, clean and bright unit!


Great Location,
- Watergate residential community, nestled on a peninsula jutting into San Francisco Bay. http://www.watergatecommunityassociation.com/
- 12 minutes from downtown SF financial district,
- short commute (BART or car) to downtown SF, Financial district, Pixar, Novartis, Bayer, Alta Bates, Kaiser, yahoo , facebook , genentech , tweeter , UC, Oakland and Berkeley. 
- Emeryville Police and Fire departments are also around the corner, making this development very safe and favorite of young single women.
- Free Emeryville shuttle to Bart and Apple shuttle station
- 3 minutes to Trader Joe's
- Electric car charging station
- 3 minutes to Shelmound street and Bay street with all shops and restaurants.
- Next to Emeryville Marina
- Easy Freeway Access 80 , 580, 880, 980 , 24 , 13
Address: 6 Admiral Dr, Emeryville, CA 

Amenities:
- Gyms
- Heated Swimming Pools
- Tennis Courts
- Sauna and steam rooms
- Indoor/outdoor Jacuzzi
- 24 hour Security monitoring and patrols
- Electric car charging station
- Free Emeryville shuttle to Bart, down town, and Apple shuttle station
- Huge Laundry room with new european style modern machines just steps from this unit

Included in rent:
- Access to all development amenities
- Basic Cable TV
- Water
- Sewer
- Garbage

The Scene,
Mostly single young professionals, physicians, consultants, attorneys, pharmacists, engineers, and managers ( Very popular with women since it is very safe and secure ).

Terms:
- Move in February 
- One year lease. 
- $ 1999 per month
- $ 1999 security deposit
- 1rst and last month rent due upon move in 
- $205 registration fee with Watergate.
No pets, no smokers, this development is pretty strict with noise disturbances and does not allow dogs on the grounds. If you like it clean and orderly, this is for you! If you like loud parties, not so much.

This is a hot rental market and there are very few units available at Watergate, don't risk loosing this unique spot!
live the same distance from dt sf as nob hill , noe valley , soma , castro , mission , pacific heights , north beach , telegraph hill , russian hill .
listings.title: Just remodeled 1 Bedroom Condo with private Patio (650 SF)

listings.description:
Welcome to Higby,

Built In 2015.

A refined living experience in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley. With modern apartments and inviting common areas, Higby creates a place that is both home and a gathering space. Within walking distance to craft breweries, celebrated restaurants, organic markets and cultural highlights, Higby celebrated exploration and adventure. 

Higby offers studio, one-, two- and three-bedroom apartments in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley

Modern building amenities include: 
•	Lobby with lounge seating and TV
•	Courtyard with a bocce ball court
•	Roof deck with a barbecue, fire pit, lounge seating and city views
•	Fitness studio
•	Indoor bike storage and work stand
•	Enclosed residential parking garage

Apartment units feature: 
•	Electric ovens
•	Gas range cooktops
•	Dishwashers
•	Washers and dryers

Higby is designed to operate 25% more efficiently than a code-compliant building. Sustainability highlights contributing to Higby's LEED Gold certification include:
•	Locally sourced and recycle content materials
•	Non-toxic finishes and a building-wide green cleaning program
•	Aggressive construction waste recycling program
•	Native, adaptive plantings to reduce water consumption
•	On-site planters to detain and manage storm water 

So Stretch out. Entertain. Sleep it off. Celebrate pajama day. Declare a lost weekend. Take a conference call from home. Do what you do. Live At Higby.


Office Hours
Monday 9am - 6pm
Tuesday 9am - 6pm
Wednesday 9am - 6pm
Thursday 9am - 6pm
Friday 9am - 6pm
Saturday 9am - 6pm
Sunday 11am - 5pm
3015 SAN PABLO AVE, Berkeley, CA 94702

www.livehigby.com

Equal Housing Opportunity

****************************************************************************************************************************************

*******************************************************************************************************************************

***.....✿ ...Visitors of guests & professional service people & inspectors often compliment THE BEL AIRE COURTYARD APARTMENTS as being in a select few group of buildings to offer the calmest, best maintained and aesthetic apartment buildings in all of Oakland.

***.....✿ ...We do try very hard to provide a BOUTIQUE LIVING EXPERIENCE where our building is closely managed to give busy people a home they can depend on to be not only functioning in every way...but to give a feeling of being in an aesthetically uplifting place with a community of well mannered tenants.


***************************************************************************************************************************************

***.....We are in the ABSOLUTELY BEST LAKE MERRITT area CALLED "ADAMS POINT"......just three blocks from downtown and the large and most unique and amazing Whole Foods Store, close to Trader Joe's... and within easy connection to Highways...80, 880 & 580.

*****************************************************************************************************************************************

***.....✿ ...Fun to use exciting new expanded size kitchen with generous size either black granite or white quartz counters...and new white cabinets & a high quality refrigerator & smooth ceramic top stove.


***.....✿ ...Large windows for great natural light... with screens for excellent ventilation & air flow in our quiet neighborhood.


***.....✿ ...The Dark Walnut Wood or Honey Maple colored floors and soft yellow walls match beautifully with the abundant white wood trim including crown molding and door & window trim. This unit could win a design award for its clean and tasteful style. Each room has a spirited accent color.
***.....✿ ...ALL NEW...Extra large Capacity Closets ( most from the "Container Store" ) with shelving for folded flat clothes...Mirror sliding doors and two additional closets for clothes and a pantry adjacent to the kitchen.

***.....✿ ...Our building has a surprise Tropical Palm Tree courtyard and many flowering plants that may amaze you and maybe make you think of the magic look you remember if you have visited Hawaii...yes right here in Oakland.


***************************************************************************************************************************************


***...✿✿✿.................................................... LEASE TERMS:

✿ NON SMOKING BUILDING...INCLUDING NO MEDICAL CERTIFICATE SMOKING ALLOWED IN APARTMENT OR ANYWHERE ON THE PREMISES.

listings.description:
Renters are facing really difficult times right now with very high rent, crazy security deposits, no pets being accepted and landlords want you to have perfect credit and income 3 times or 4 higher than the rent just to allow you to rent their house and pay it off for them. Then they want to increase the rent every time the lease it up and in many cases ask you to move so they can sell the house or move back into it. 

We can send you all of the program information in writing just by sending a request. it includes all of our licensing information. You can call Lynne Duban the Finance Director at

to qualify as long as you have a 580 or higher credit score and can document your income. We get so many people who worry this is a scam but everything we provide you is verifiable through multiple governmental sources.

I have sold homes from Berkeley to Discovery Bay for 27 years. I have managed special financing programs provided by the State and Federal Government that encourage renters to become home owners by providing financing options that don't require perfect credit and in most cases cost less to get into than a rental these days. The financing is 30 year fixed rate and includes property taxes, and all the insurance. Simply put, people who bought homes 15 years ago are still paying the same payment they had originally and you will have the same payment 15 years after you buy the house. Landlords will obviously not be keeping the rent at the same level.

In addition there are tax benefits that you get as a homeowner that help most people save thousands per year in Income Tax. This is the part where many people start to think this is a scam or baloney in general. To help with that we offer two things. I am going to give you ways to confirm the information. In addition I can send you an e mail that has both detailed breakdowns on the programs as well as an e mail that has the properties available with pictures and details. 

The programs that we utilize are FHA, VA, USDA Guaranteed, we also use CHDAP California Housing Down Payment Assistance Program, and CHFA California Housing Finance Agency. These last two programs are state based and provide almost 100% of the down payment you need for the FHA Loan. USDA and VA don't require any down payment. 

This house in Discovery Bay is just 1 of 57 available in Brentwood and Discovery Bay. It offers 3 Bedrooms, 2 1/2 Bathrooms and over 2000 square feet and is in beautiful condition. Its on a 9000 square foot lot with a 2 car attached garage and side access right near the lake.

The other 56 houses range in size from 1,000-3900 square feet and 2-5 bedrooms. The monthly payments range from $1950-$3400. 

The cost to move into one of the homes will typically be $3,000-$5,000. Your first payment will not be due until 30 days after you move in. 

To qualify you will need the following minimum qualifications
A credit score that is 580 or higher (You can check your score at credit karma if you aren't sure)
Proof of income in the form of 30 days paystubs and the last 2 tax returns
No Short Sale Bankruptcy or Foreclosure in the last 3 years

Eric Wexelman Licensed by the California Department of Real Estate. Texts and E mails are responded to fastest as I can't answer the phone when I am with other clients. I WILL SEND YOU A FULL BREAKDOWN ON THE PROGRAMS AND HOW TO QUALIFY AND ALL THE PROPERTIES INCLUDING PICTURES AND DETAILS IF YOU TELL ME WHICH CITIES YOU ARE INTERESTED IN.
