listings.title: Large studio Apartment near UC Campus

listings.description:
Shown by Appointment.

This approx. 1601-square-foot live/work artist's loft is located in the historic Clawson School built in 1917. The pride of Oakland's school system for 52 years, this grand building features art deco brick-and-molded-terracotta facade detail rare to find in a residential setting. This ground-floor loft features high ceilings throughout with upgraded architectural design features like a raised bamboo floor, corrugated aluminum siding in spots and a flowing waterfall which can give a zen-like feel and sound, among others. With its large double-paned windows and the beautiful daytime natural light creates the perfect atmosphere for a creative tenant. The very large main space includes an ample, well-equipped kitchen and dining area. The large bathroom has a shower/tub combo, washer and dryer. 

Create your own living layout in this spacious unit that is plenty large enough for a couple. No one is living below, above or around you in the large main space, which gives you the freedom to work late, make noise or watch movies at any hour of the night, making this a truly unique environment. There is simply nothing like it on the market now. Right above, a virtually private deck enables you to sit or barbecue outdoors. There are windows on three sides that allow a sweet marine bay cross-breeze if opened, never getting too hot in summer. Just outside, apple, peach and Asian pears produce fruit in season and lemon trees offer their bounty year-round. There are three common area outside decks that can be used by anyone. This unit has tons of soul and emits creative energy from the solid concrete that housed young children learning and at play for 60 years! They can't build buildings like this anymore. 

The 28-unit building houses an artist/young professional community and the unit itself was previously occupied by a renown artist. Looking for a tenant who loves this space, is responsible, and will enjoy being part of this vibrant community.

Includes:
- water, garbage and sewer 
- washer and dryer in unit
- brand new stainless steel refrigerator
- microwave oven
- brand new semi-pro gas range and oven
- Bosch "quiet" dishwasher
- Cuisinart coffee machine
- garbage disposal
- central gas heating
- double-paned windows
- dehumidifier
- one convenient secure parking space in back lot
- additional parking in front lot
- large closet
- gate clicker
- pest control
- running water fall 
- ceiling fan
- IKEA wardrobe x4

Pets are negotiable. . .

Location:
- 3240 Peralta St. Unit #1
- access to I-80, I-580, CA-24 I-880 and the Bay bridge are just blocks away.
- a few blocks from major shopping: Home Depot, Ikea, Target, Best Buy, AMC, 
Emery Bay Mall, Safeway, Trader Joe's, Starbucks, etc.
- on Emeryville-West Oakland border - a few blocks from the Pixar campus
- minutes from West Oakland Bart and SF is 12 minutes away from there

Terms:
- Available April 1st, 2016
- 1 year lease
- Rent = monthly @ $3640
- Security deposit $4500
- No cigarette smoking
- Renter's insurance required
- No sublets
- Must follow WCL HOA CC&Rs and Rules
- $100 move in/out fee.
- $25 application fee

Please reply to this post if you would like to see this listing and make an appointment to see it or have questions. The $25 application fee will be waived if a current credit report (within 2 weeks) is provided by applicants. 


Some more info on history of the building:
In 1971, Clawson was the center of Superintendent Marcus Foster's partnership with UC Berkeley working to improve education for low-income students. In the mid-1970's, the building became Oakland's foray into creating a public school dedicated to the arts. Dogtown Developers purchased the building from Oakland Unified School District in 1999, after it closed in 1979, and renovated it to create these unique and amazing live/work lofts.

In addition to the above, a carport parking space and a 9' x 3' x 5' carport storage will be provided. 

Rent: $2,175 (includes water, sewer & garbage). Resident only pays electricity and gas.

Southshore Gardens Apartments is conveniently located in Alameda, a block from beautiful Crown Memorial Beach and the very popular Alameda Town Centre Shopping Center where you will find almost everything you need. The Transbay Express bus to Mission and First Street in Downtown San Francisco, and buses to Fruitvale BART and the Alameda/Oakland Ferry are a few steps away. Freeway 880 is easily accessible to San Francisco, Oakland, Berkeley and Fremont.

Community features:

- Community Pool

- Assigned Carport Parking
- Free Storage 

Interior Features:

- Fresh Paint

Pet Policy: Indoor cats (spayed/neutered, maximum two) with additional deposit and monthly rent. 

Come tour our community today.

to schedule a tour today!

listings.title: 1Bd/1Ba Jr, 520 sq ft @ Stevenson Place

listings.description:
CABIN IN WOODS
artistic, poetic, funky, unique.
The cabin is a large studio with apprx. 550 sq ft. a small balcony overlooks the canyon of Sausal Creek, and its winter creek. The living area has french doors leading to the balcony as well as a wall of windows through which the acacias and oak trees are visible. Off the living area is the kitchen with cement counter tops and a gas stove and full size refrigerator with lower freezer compartment. To the right of the entry is a small hallway leading to a walk in closet and tiled bathroom with redwood shower stall. The floor is a composite wood shearing material (OSB)... Parking is off-street and an on-site laundry room.
The cabin is located behind a brown shingle duplex 4674 Dolores Ave. Oakland 94602. Face the duplex and walk down the driveway on the left and through a wooden gate, continue down the path to cabin. Dolores is a quiet street one block long which intersects Park Blvd. Park Blvd has direct bus lines to SF and informal commute stops as well as transport to downtown Oakland and Berkeley.
A short walk to Glenview Shopping Center (coffee bar, restaurants, grocery store, dentist, etc) Close to Montclair Golf Course and Driving Range. Walk to Dimond Recreation Center and Lions Pool -- year round out-door heated pool . Close to Farmer Joes and Montclair Shopping area for major grocery and retail stores. Minutes from the Park exit off either Hwy 13 coming from Berkeley and Walnut Creek and the 580 Freeway from S.F. or Oakland
Viewings this weekend March 26 Saturday from 1-4 pm and March 27 Sunday 1-4pm. Additional viewing can be arranged next week during weekdays if you email me and give me some time to arrange. Available now! Please email me for questions but if the information is contained in this ad I wont answer so read whole ad before emailing, Dogs and cats Ok.Utilities included. Do not walk around the property or disturb other tenants, just remember to walk down the driveway through the wood gate on the path which leads to the cabin. Stay in this area only. Thanks. uded my email in ad text. You can email me at luckymollin at ya hoo . com to arrange additional viewings or ask questions not answered in ad. Thank you!

Furnitures are not included, so you will need your own furnitures.

The flat is conveniently located in the Santa Fe neighborhood of the North Oakland/Berkeley/Emeryville (NOBE) area in close proximity to shopping, the major freeways, bus lines, and BART (1.2 miles from Ashby, 1.7 miles to MacArthur).

This beautiful, well-lit, spacious upper flat of a duplex is available for rent now. There are 3 bedrooms in the unit with an additional office/bonus room.

It has hardwood floors throughout and big, west-facing windows that bring in lots of afternoon sun. 

Each unit in the duplex has a garage (generally used by previous tenants for storage). There is also a long driveway where a few cars can be parked off-street. Laundry is free and shared with the lower unit.

The security deposit is equal to one month's rent. With a year lease, we don't mind if the deposit is paid over 2 months.

Thanks for your interest. Please email me to schedule a time to view the apartment.

Please contact me for the open house details. Open house is this Saturday from 11:30-1:30
Wonderful 1bd/1ba unit in the desirable Parkwoods gated community just off Tunnel Road in Oakland, near the Caldecott tunnel.
Close to freeway access (hwy 24) and BART station.
Close to Rockridge and College Ave. Quick trip to Berkeley.
This unit has approx. 728sq ft. of living space.
It is located on the 2nd level of the building and is accessible by both elevator and stairs.
Away from freeway and very quiet.
Great view of hillside from living room and bedroom.
Neutral colors of paint and carpet throughout. In great condition!!!
Walk in and the kitchen is on the right. It features white tile counter tops, fridge, dishwasher, garbage disposal, gas range, oven, and microwave.
Stackable washer and dryer included in kitchen closet.
Living room is spacious and bright. It features natural carpet and gas fireplace.
There is also a slider to the porch outside. Storage unit on porch.
There are perimeter electric wall heaters with individual controls.
To the left of the entry is the bathroom, which has entry from the bedroom as well. It is large and features single sink vanity and shower over tub.
The bedroom connects to the bathroom. It is good sized and features a large walk in closet and slider to porch outside.
Fire sprinklers in unit.
Community pool, Clubhouse, Gym.
Water, garbage and HOA dues included.

listings.description:
Hi! 

We have a large, gorgeous, pet-friendly 3rd floor studio with a private huge sunny deck and a beautiful view of the bay for sublet for May and June. Our dates are flexible so please email and let us know if you are interested in just one month or both months. 

There is a ton of light inside this unit, thanks to a lot of windows and a sun roof! We are also happy to share our projector where you can watch TV/movies on a large projected screen on the wall. The couch is also a pull-out sofa bed should you need to accommodate extra guests. The kitchen is fully functional, recently remodeled with granite counter. As a bonus, there is also an indoor jacuzzi that accommodates 2-4 people! There is also dedicated parking space in the driveway for 1-2 cars, in addition to street parking. There is a washer and dryer in the unit. And the rent includes all utilities and Internet. 

What we love about this place is also the location. It's just a 10-min walk from Ashby BART. We are a couple blocks from Nomad Coffee, Jumping Java, Starry Plough, Le Pena, etc, and about 10-min walk from Berkeley Bowl and Bushrod Park. We love being in North Oakland because we get easy access to the best of Berkeley and Oakland.

We are a couple going on an extended adventure travel in May and June. And we would love to share our space with someone who appreciates this unique studio. Please email us sharing a bit about yourselves, and what dates you are interested. If this post is live, that means the sublet is still available.

Thanks!
Chloe

listings.description:
Housed in a vintage 1924 dry goods warehouse, Blue Cap Lofts bridge the gap between the industrial and the residential and offer the best of both worlds. The artful re-use of this masonry structure is a perfect home/office space for creators and entrepreneurs who enjoy the broad concept of live/work. For a complete list of the architectural and design features of the building, click here: http://www.bluecaplofts.com/features-gallery/With open but defined areas, Unit #7 features a flexible floor plan with a wide mezzanine, providing endless possibilities for live, work, and creative adaptations of space to suit individual tastes and needs. Unit 7 is zoned for residential and commercial use, and is 1328 sqft.  The main level has an open kitchen/living area with exposed brick and floor-to-ceiling windows. The ultra modern kitchen has honed natural stone countertops for full dinner preparations, high efficiency GE Cafe Series stainless steel appliances including dishwasher, microwave, refrigerator and gas range with hood. Tucked behind the kitchen is a full bathroom and laundry area. The lower bathroom is ADA adapted for commercial use and includes shower stall. The laundry nook has full size side-by-side high-efficiency Whirlpool washer/dryer. Wooden staircase leads to a lofted, spacious sleeping/living area with a remote-controlled skylight, exposed overhead beams, and hardwood floors. This lofted level has the 2nd high-end bathroom with a separate shower and tub, and a deep closet.Unit #7 comes with a small storage locker. The building has a bike parking room with lockable bike rack, secure key card entry system at the front and rear lobby, and utilizes exterior security cameras with an interior monitoring system. Secure exterior parking spot for semi-compact car available for $50/month. Blue Cap Lofts is a small, sought-after condo conversion in the heart of rapidly changing West Oakland. A commuter's paradise, West Oakland has its own ramp to the toll plaza on the Bay Bridge - there is no community in the East Bay that lies closer to downtown San Francisco. From the West Oakland BART station, commuters arrive in downtown San Francisco BART stations in as little as 8 minutes. By car, West Oakland is literally only minutes away from the City, Oakland, Emeryville (with its chic shopping district on Bay St.), and Berkeley. Quick access to the 880 Freeway makes for a relatively easy commute to the South Bay as well.Blue Cap Lofts also enjoy surprising proximity to many of Oakland's most popular attractions:- Bay Bridge Trail bike path - walk or ride along the new Bay Bridge and destined to eventually provide access to Treasure Island.- FuseBox Restaurant - located directly across the street on Magnolia, a new foodie lunch and dinner favorite with outdoor patio seating.- Mandela Parkway - a popular walking and cycling commuter thoroughfare and dog walk connecting West Oakland BART at 7th Street to Emeryville. Stop at new Kilovolt Coffee on the way!- Brown Sugar Kitchen - Owned by a famed chef and serving breakfast and lunch daily, plus a sumptuous Sunday brunch just blocks away!- Oakland's Art Murmur/First Friday events and an every-growing array of upscale Uptown restaurants and bars are only minutes away. Uptown Oakland starts 6 blocks down West Grand Avenue from Blue Cap Lofts- A convenient bus stop less than 2 blocks away provides express bus service (N route) to San Francisco Transbay Terminal.Available now. Please call or email to take a look.Andrea

AndreaRentalsA Rental Concierge for Bay Area Owners and Renterswww.andrearentals.com

One year lease

Application requirements are at the bottom of the ad


The next showings will be at:
12:00pm sharp on Friday, March 25th
and 1:00pm sharp on Saturday, March 26th
At 2491 Ellsworth Street in Berkeley 
It's a locking building, so I will meet you out front and take you up at the showing time. Anyone who arrives after that will unfortunately miss the showing


Applications are paper or pdf only, available at the end of the viewing.
All applicants over 18 need to fill out an application and provide a $40 application fee in cashier's check or money order payable to Picardo Arms Apartments.There is a $100 holding deposit. We only process one person's or one set of roommates' applications at a time. The deposit takes the apartment off the market and is refundable for up to three business days. After that, it's non-refundable. Bring all of your documents at the same time, and we process your application well within the three days. If you pass, the deposit becomes the first $100 of your security deposit. If you don't pass, even if your application is processed after the three business days, we return the $100 to you. The $40 application fees are non-refundable once the applications are processed regardless of the result.Applicants must show combined income of at least 3x the rent amount per month gross (pre-tax) and good credit based in the U.S. If credit and income aren't met (and the applicant does not have overly poor credit) then a cosigner may be used. A cosigner applies in the same way with another $40 application fee. A copy of a passport or driver's license and proof of income is required for each application. Proof of income can be in the form of two recent pay stubs, social security checks, pension, trust fund or support checks, or tax returns.
Note for new international residents: if you don't have a credit history in the U.S. because of your national status, you may be exempt from the credit requirement; however, you will still need to meet the income requirement and will be required to pay an increased security desposit.
All fees and charges, including move in fees, must be in the form of cashier's check or money order, payable to Picardo Arms. Once you are a tenant, from your 2nd month onward, you may pay by personal check.

listings.description:
Welcome To Higby

Built In 2015.

A refined living experience in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley. With modern apartments and inviting common areas, Higby creates a place that is both home and a gathering space. Within walking distance to craft breweries, celebrated restaurants, organic markets and cultural highlights, Higby celebrated exploration and adventure. 

Higby offers studio, one-, two- and three-bedroom apartments in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley

Modern building amenities include: 
•	Lobby with lounge seating and TV
•	Courtyard with a bocce ball court
•	Roof deck with a barbecue, fire pit, lounge seating and city views
•	Fitness studio
•	Indoor bike storage and work stand
•	Enclosed residential parking garage

Apartment units feature: 
•	Electric ovens
•	Gas range cooktops
•	Dishwashers
•	Washers and dryers

Higby is designed to operate 25% more efficiently than a code-compliant building. Sustainability highlights contributing to Higby's LEED Gold certification include:
•	Locally sourced and recycle content materials
•	Non-toxic finishes and a building-wide green cleaning program
•	Aggressive construction waste recycling program
•	Native, adaptive plantings to reduce water consumption
•	On-site planters to detain and manage storm water 

So Stretch out. Entertain. Sleep it off. Celebrate pajama day. Declare a lost weekend. Take a conference call from home. Do what you do. Live At Higby.


Office Hours
Monday 9am - 6pm
Tuesday 9am - 6pm
Wednesday 9am - 6pm
Thursday 9am - 6pm
Friday 9am - 6pm
Saturday 10am - 5pm
Sunday 10am - 5pm

3015 SAN PABLO AVE, Berkeley, CA 94702

www.livehigby.com

Beautiful, light filled open-plan home with enormous windows and wooden floors throughout. Custom built in early 2000s, excellent condition. One floor has been used as a children's suite, with two bedrooms, a full bathroom, full playroom and access to the fully fenced 1/3 acre backyard. Other floor has kitchen, huge living room, library/dining room, full laundry room, master bedroom with huge walk-in closet and separate bathroom. Large chicken coop and sunny open space for serious gardening- no pesticides or non-organic materials used on property for 20 years. Bring your kids, your pets and your gardening tools...

Welcome To Higby

Built In 2015.

A refined living experience in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley. With modern apartments and inviting common areas, Higby creates a place that is both home and a gathering space. Within walking distance to craft breweries, celebrated restaurants, organic markets and cultural highlights, Higby celebrated exploration and adventure. 

Higby offers studio, one-, two- and three-bedroom apartments in the heart of historic Southwest Berkeley

Modern building amenities include: 
•	Lobby with lounge seating and TV
•	Courtyard with a bocce ball court
•	Roof deck with a barbecue, fire pit, lounge seating and city views
•	Fitness studio
•	Indoor bike storage and work stand
•	Enclosed residential parking garage

Apartment units feature: 
•	Electric ovens
•	Gas range cooktops
•	Dishwashers
•	Washers and dryers

Higby is designed to operate 25% more efficiently than a code-compliant building. Sustainability highlights contributing to Higby's LEED Gold certification include:
•	Locally sourced and recycle content materials
•	Non-toxic finishes and a building-wide green cleaning program
•	Aggressive construction waste recycling program
•	Native, adaptive plantings to reduce water consumption
•	On-site planters to detain and manage storm water 

So Stretch out. Entertain. Sleep it off. Celebrate pajama day. Declare a lost weekend. Take a conference call from home. Do what you do. Live At Higby.

listings.description:
For non -- smokers only; Fully furnished per pictures, fully equipped kitchen with everything one may need: pots, pans, microwave, toaster, dishes, silverware, full refrigerator, stove/oven. Located in a quiet upscale residential neighborhood just two short blocks from charming Point Richmond downtown with some 30 restaurants, couple of coffee shops (yes, Starbucks too) couple of restaurant bars just like in the City of San Francisco.

- Dish TV with some 200 channels, Wi-Fi
- Hardwood floors (safe against toe fungus and other diseases that one may catch from carpets)
- Full size bathtub
- Vintage look with two tone painting. Ceiling fan in the bedroom, Ceiling fan in the kitchen
- New/clean towels & linens provided.

Point Richmond is as safe as it gets: For the past 30 years there was only 1 'domestic' homicide there, which can happen just about everywhere; no shooting out in the streets EVER in point Richmond.

As shown in the pictures there is a dining area, large living room with a love seat and leather chair, and a round table with four chairs inside the bay window area for tea/coffee time or small conferences. The living room has 6 large window, all with a view of the 2 beautiful churches diagonally across and the serene view of the Point Richmond hills. There is also a closet for coats etc. The bedroom feature a dresser, a queen size bed, a large window and a large closet. WE OFFER A WEEKLY LINEN SERVICE AT NO ADDITIONAL COST.

The fully equipped kitchen has a large window with view, two granite counters, a stainless steal sink and some 16 or so cabinets - lots of storage place. Everything is newly remodeled and in as new condition.

The bathroom has full bath with a special handle for additional safety and a window with a view.

Travel, according to Google map, depending on traffic but gives you an idea: Golden Gate, San Francisco 21 minutes, Bay Bridge, San Francisco 20 minutes, University Ave, Berkeley 12 minutes, Richmond BART 8 minutes, Center of San Rafael CA North Bay 13 minutes.

A short video about Point Richmond sights: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4vuS8k_vLZA&list=PLhLAMl2nWuUpPJtPq7Y3an2aW_p1DFrbx&index=28

a review of 24 Point Richmond Downtown restaurants on yelp http://www.yelp.com/search?find_desc=Restaurants+Downtown&find_loc=Point+Richmond%2C+CA

- "Simple Pleasures" with Patrick Kelly Jones - if you are up for a little walking around for some of the best view of the Bay Area: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v1M8q8kNzhY

listings.description:
Sweet 2 bedroom one bath apartment on quiet street, walkable to Ashby BART, Berkeley Bowl (both of them) and an easy ride to Cal. 

The apartment is the upstairs of a 1906 Victorian, with old-time charm, but renovated 4 years ago (new bathroom, floors, some new windows, new skylight, new lights, new refridgerator). One bedroom is quite large, the other much smaller, and there is a great room with high ceilings and an eat in kitchen. Great light with a nice layout.

The apartment has a small, European-type side yard, with a privacy fence and perfect for a bistro table and bbq-- it has fruit trees and a prolific grape vine. There are some small beds for you to tend your green friends. There is a shared washer/dryer (brand new and free) in a shed in the garden that is shared with one other tenant. Altogether, there are three units on the property, it is a quiet and serene place to live.

Like all properties in Berkeley, this apartment is no smoking.

Rent includes trash and water/sewer. We are a little flexible on move in, but there tenants are moving out on the 15th of April. Super easy on street parking-- although the last several tenants have lived here car-free.

listings.description:
June 1 -- Aug 15 flex (NO shorter lease), with some flexibility at either end. The monthly $2500 rent includes phone (unlimited long distance), DSL, basic utilities charges. 

**Note: we will be able to show our home beginning on Monday, March 28, 2016

Despite its size, house OCCUPANCY IS LIMITED TO TWO PEOPLE (& 1-2 occasional very short term visitors) by owners to keep overall usage of the house to a relatively light level. NO PETS ARE ALLOWED, either outside or inside the house. Although the house is clean, the number of Persian rugs in it does not make it an optimal living space for those who are asthmatic. 

Rent is kept low in recognition that tenants will be expected to water the garden when and where necessary, as well as forward mail.

This spacious (2200+sq ft), private, Mediterranean stucco house is surrounded by woods, with an outdoor dining deck beneath a grape arbor (the picture with the table shaded by umbrella was taken before the umbrella was replaced by the arbor), looking out towards the Golden Gate through the trees, with fruit trees, a sunny backyard, bay views, and a grand piano for the musically inclined. It is about a mile downhill to the UC campus and downtown Berkeley, and within walking distance to bus stops. 

There is an 18 step access down to the house, and no wheelchair accessibility. The house includes:

* Bedrooms: 1 master, 1 inlaw unit w. separate entrance, 1 loft bedroom.
* A small office (inlaw unit also has an office area).
* A dining room and large living room with scenic windows and grand piano.
* Library with woodstove.
* Modern kitchen with dishwasher.
* Laundry nook with washer and dryer. 
* Private cement slab for streetside parking.

listings.description:
Available May 15, 2015. 
High ceilings/top floor! $2650/month ($2,850 couple) including water and garbage. Wifi, cable, electricity, and enclosed parking additional. Nine month minimum. Prefer at least one year; long-term residency desired.

Rent my roomy, furnished sunny one-bedroom modern condo (about 80 sq. meters or 900 sq. ft. w/ covered balcony). On top floor (4th) of redecorated building with elevator. 15-foot-high ceiling in living/dining room; breakfast counter/bar; computer area (with modern workforce® computer desk, cabinet storage, counter space); wall-to-wall carpeting and parquet kitchen/hall floors; large closet; full-sized newer washer and dryer IN UNIT, large new stainless steel refrigerator, dishwasher; garbage disposal; microwave; bathroom with tub/shower. Wood-burning fireplace. Living room opens onto skylight-covered private balcony with view to the park for al fresco dining.

Apartment furnishings include queen-sized bed, dresser, kitchen utensils, dishes, pots and pans, linens. Queen futon couch, two comfy easy chairs and ottoman, TV, DVD & VCR players, desk, solid maple dining room table and chairs. Overstuffed upholstered chairs [shown] and futon [shown] and larger computer desk recently replaced the vintage bamboo and wicker furniture in some photos. Roof deck with 360° views, great for sun-worshippers or stargazing. This is in addition to your private view balcony with umbrella, table and chairs and lush plants. 

This desirable Adams Point condo is across from lovely Lake Merritt in Oakland, just off Grand Ave., walking distance to 19th St. BART station and Grand/Lakeshore shopping district including Arizmendi Bakery, coffeehouses (Peet's, Starbucks), beautiful Whole Foods (walking distance), Trader Joe's, Noah's bagels, fine restaurants and cafes; Rockridge and Piedmont Ave. shopping and recreation minutes away by car or bike. Sunday farmer's market at Jack London Square, or Saturday's in neighborhood -- and then there's always Chinatown restaurants and markets. Walking distance or short drive to the hip new Uptown District's trendy restaurants, bars and art galleries. You'll love my neighborhood!

Short commute to San Francisco, Emeryville, Berkeley (UC) or Mills College; 15 minute walk to downtown Oakland 19th St. BART. Rent includes garbage and water. One reserved parking space in secure garage in building available. Cable ready. ($2975 One person all-inclusive includes Wifi, cable, electricity allowance, local phone and parking.) Move-out cleaning fee of $75 and security deposit required.

Please E-mail with your DATES, PERSONAL INFORMATION and PHONE NUMBER for call back.
BUT -- VERY IMPORTANT: FIRST Please tell me a little about yourself as the most important thing is that you are responsible, dependable, and quiet, and will respect my condo and neighbors. Where do you work? Where do you live now and why do you want a sublet, etc.? I need to know about you and then talk to you before I will schedule an appointment or confirm. Thank you!

We've a cozy modern large 1 bedroom approx. 700sq ft located in Watergate next to the Emeryville Marina. It's a quiet TOP floor unit with enclosed balcony and beautiful mountain views! 

Property Description:
Watergate is a beautifully landscape 24 acre community on the Emeryville Peninsula on San Francisco Bay. There are 1247 condominium homes in six low rise buildings. There is an extensive variety of recreational facilities and programs. Watergate is conveniently located one mile north from the Bay Bridge, west of the East Shore Freeway 880 and 80, within minutes of downtown San Francisco and /Berkeley. listings.description:
A spacious and sunny three bedroom and one bathroom apartment located on the top floor of a seismically retrofitted three story building. Around the corner are all the stores and restaurants of the Gourmet Ghetto, and it is about a 15 minute walk to campus and BART. The building has a coin operated laundry room on site. A parking space along with water and garbage are included with rent.

The unit has windows on three of four sides and a balcony off the living room allowing a lot of sunlight throughout the day. The flooring throughout the unit is wood without any carpet anywhere, the kitchen has granite countertops. The unit also has Restoration Hardware drapes on all the the windows. Each bedroom is large enough to accommodate up to a king size bed with a small desk and dresser. There are two common area closets, and each bedroom has its own closet. 

The application fee is $39.95 and co-signor application fee is $29.95. The security deposit is 1.5 months rent and no first or last month rent required. The unit will be available June 1, 2015, and a one year lease required. No groups of four or more unrelated people, no smokers, and no pets.

Please contact for more information about a showing and and include information about you and your group.

This building is fully compliant with Berkeley Soft Story Code and E3 program.

2020 Bancroft Way Apt. 101
Berkeley, CA 94704

listings.description:
Library Gardens' Berkeley apartments feature modern appointments including:

-Gourmet Kitchens with Breakfast Bars, Double-Basin Sinks, Garbage Disposals, 
and GE Appliances including Built-in Microwaves, Full-Size Refrigerators, 
and Full-Size Dishwashers
-Pre-wired for Cable, Internet Service, and Multiple Phone Lines in Each Residence
-Spacious Closets with European-Style Shelving
-Lofty 10-Foot Ceilings
-Roommate-Friendly Floor Plans -- Perfect for Students
-Environmentally-Friendly Paint, Adhesives and Carpets for Better Indoor Air Quality

Library Gardens, Berkeley's premier apartment community, features an extensive array of amenities:

-24-Hour Laundry Care Centers on Each Floor 
-Wireless Connection throughout Community 
-Small Dogs and Cats Welcome 
-Bike Racks and Lockers 
-Monthly On-Site Parking Available 
-VIP Parking for Hybrids and Alternative Fuel Vehicles 
-Plentiful Guest Parking 
-Complimentary Package Acceptance Service 
-Copy and Fax Service 
-Private Access Entry 
-Verdant Private Courtyards and Terraces

Library Gardens offers modern, beautiful Berkeley apartments in the heart of vibrant downtown Berkeley:

-One block to UC Berkeley Campus
-One block to public transport (BART, AC Transit)
-Steps to restaurants, cafes, bookstores and shopping
-Over 20 movie screens within 1/2 block, including fine art film venues 
-Adjacent to Berkeley's Public Library, YMCA and the Habitot Children's Museum 

*Prices are subject to change daily
*Furniture is not included only high speed internet,cable and trash
listings.title: 2BR Downtown Berkeley move in - June 6th

listings.description:
We are just across the street from Campus on North Side, and next door to Etcheverry and Soda Halls. Our bldg is well maintained and recently seismically retrofitted to meet the latest standards and requirements of the city of Berkeley. Our tenants are very considered and focused on their studies and we like to keep our bldg quiet for the comfort of all. 
Large living area, double pane windows, with a view stretching all the way to the Golden Gate Bridge, large kitchen with family size refrigerator, stove-oven, dining area, bathroom with shower over bathtub, huge walk-in closet.
Manager on site, laundry room in the bldg, parking with a fee, $100/month, in our attached garage.

Available June 1st, 2016. First month rent and a $ 2100 refundable deposit are due upon signing the lease. Landlord pays for water and garbage collection.
Sadly we cannot accommodate pets of any kind or size
SHOWING WILL BE ON SATURDAY APRIL 7, 2016 AT 11AM, FOR HALF HOUR

Within one mile to West Berkeley Bowl (groceries), 4th St shops and many cafes and restaurants. There is an old industrial Sawtooth Building filled with artist studios a block away. The venerable Black Oak Books has relocated nearby. Close by Aquatic Park surrounds a 2 mile lake. Bay front parks and the marina are within strolling distance. Only a three min. walk to Rudramandir. The University is a short bus ride away. Berkeley is across the Bay from SF.

The home is a few blocks to major bus lines. Ride to/from BART, (a mile and a half), or train station, (two miles), likely on arrival/departure.

Call Gary

listings.title: LARGE TWO BEDROOM APT OPEN HOUSE

listings.description:
Classic stucco 2 bedroom bungalow in highly sought after Westbrae neighborhood. 




Here are some features of the home:

* Quiet, close knit block, walking distance to all Giman shopping district has to offer (Whole foods, Lalime's, Acme, etc...)
* Pleasant 15 minute walk to North Berkeley BART, AC Transit bus stop 3 blocks from home
* Large living room great for entertaining 
* Hardwood floors and vaulted ceilings through out
* Bright living room with two exposures 
* Gas furnace contolled with programable thermostat 
* 2 bedrooms and 1bath with large master 
* Galley style kitchen with stainless steel gas range, refrigerator
* Level lot with fenced backyard
* Full size washer and dryer 
* Driveway and carport provide off street parking
* Residents responsible for utilities and garden/landscape. Owner pays garbage service 
* Built in 1950's home has plenty of original charm
* Home square footage is approx. 805 
* Lot is 2500 sqft. 



Offered at: $4300 per month. 1 year lease, security deposit, last month, pet deposit(if applicable)

Sufficient income is required by prospective applicants, commonly income would be 2.5x the rent.

Please email with a brief description of yourself and your situation and your phone number to coordinate an appointment.

listings.description:
This is for a classic colonial house in the beautiful North Berkeley Hills. It has 3+ bedrooms including the master bedroom occupying the entire second floor. It includes a big kitchen, laundry, a dinning and living room, two bathrooms, fireplace, central heating, a small breakfast room, and two decks with a magnificent view of the Bay (you can see the Golden Gate, the Bay Bridge, and part of the south bay). It's most suitable for a family. 

The house is located on a very quiet street in an excellent neighborhood. Yet, it's very conveniently located. It's just a 10-minute walk to adjacent Solano Ave shopping neighborhood, and it's close to public transportation. 

Pets are welcome. The house is available May 1. Security deposit is two months rent that will be interest accruing. 

We have an open house to show the place TODAY 4/9 between 11:00am and 1:30pm. For details, please reply to this posting. Thanks!

listings.description:
Beautiful and furnished studio/apartment attached to a well-appointed and gorgeous custom designed north Berkeley Hills house with its own private entrance. Breathtaking views of Golden Gate, Bay and Richmond bridges and San Francisco skyline from secluded backyard. Great views of Wildcat Canyon regional park from secluded front yard. Large closet in bedroom, new hard wood floors, bathroom, kitchenette/dining room, fridge, oven/stove, microwave, laundry and wireless internet/DirecTV access. Additional storage space and room furniture available. Sunny garden surrounded by fruit, bamboo and pine trees, great for relaxation. 
Share the beautiful yards with one mature, considerate, healthy and well balanced professional couple. No smoking or pets. Please describe yourself and your habits in your email response. 
Plenty of free parking available on this tranquil dead-end street. Drive 10-15 min to UCB, 5-10 min to I-80, I-580, BART and North Berkeley/Kensington/El Cerrito shopping, 2-5 min to Tilden Park, golf and public tennis courts. Public transportation available. Truly a retreat!

to confirm viewing appointment. Mention 1644 Oxford 1bd. Application provided after tour.

1644 Oxford Street, Berkeley, CA 94709

Long term lease through May 31, 2017.

Sorry, No Pets
Cosigners are required for each tenant. 

Utilities
Landlord pays: Garbage.
Tenant pays: Gas/electricity and water/sewer. 

Parking
Optional garage parking.

The Location
Quiet North Berkeley short walk to campus, Downtown Berkeley, and Gourmet Ghetto. 2-3 blocks to Andronico's, Philz Coffee, Walgreens, Peets, Safeway and Gourmet Ghetto dining. 5 min walk to CAL campus. 10 min walk to Downtown/BART/AC Transit Hub (10 min). Bus stop AC Transit Line 67 on the same block.

The Premises
Well lit 3-story apartment building with attentive onsite manager. Units are accessed via secure intercom entrance and interior hallway by either an elevator or common area staircase at each end of the building. Secured onsite laundry room. Security monitoring system. Onsite bike parking. Secured mail boxes. 

The Apartment
Large unit with spacious living room - perfect for multiple occupancy. Professionally cleaned - carpet shampooed, bathroom bleach cleaned, and complete kitchen wipe down. The bedroom is good size at approximately 150 sq ft with dual sliding door closet. Upgraded dual-pane windows to keep environment comfy and electrical bill low. Cable ready. Full bath in cultured marble flooring and shower surround. Smoke-free environment. No pets. Individual central heating & cooling via forced air. Kitchen includes refrigerator, garbage disposal, and built-in stove & oven.

listings.description:
Beautiful private studio within 10 min walk to BART and 15 min bike ride to UC Berkeley. 

The studio is on the bottom floor of our home and has it's own private entrance. It has wood flooring, bathroom/shower and kitchenette. There are two small closets.There is a large, private back yard with a hot tub that we share. There is also a shared washer/dryer. Prior tenants have told us how much they love the calm and peaceful feel of the space.

Directly above the studio is our bedrooms and sound transfer can be an issue. We have a daughter in elementary school who gets up and goes to bed early. We have a strong need for quiet hours between 9pm to 6am and our ideal candidate will be someone who can very respectfully keep those hours. That means no TV without head phones, guests visiting, talking on the phone, etc. during those hours. If those strict quiet hours work for you then please apply.

Studio will be available sometime between May 01st to May 15th. 

Lease is $1475 and includes all utilities (including Wifi). Requesting first, last and deposit.

If you are interested, please email us with information about you (what do you do, how long do you want to rent, how will the quiet hours work for you, and anything else you want us to consider). If this post is still up then the studio is available. Please email us the info about yourself along with any questions you may have.

Thanks!

listings.description:
Hi there, 

Our lease is up end of July and we would like to move out for June 1. You can sign on to finish our 2 month lease or sign a new lease. 

The building is pet friendly and it has Washer Dryer in Unit.

Our unit is on the second floor and has a balcony/courtyard view. *elevator only goes up to first floor*

There is a nice walk in closet in the bedroom and additional closet in the living room. 

If you're looking to test out the Berkeley area and then here's your chance. The location is great, near North Berkeley BART, and two blocks from Ohlone park (has a dog park). 

Utilities are not included and on average are around $100 per month and the pet fee is $65 per month. The current market rate for these units is: $2,634 so if you sign a 12 month lease that's around what you'll be looking at to pay. Parking in the building is available but I believe it is around $70-100 per month. There's also decent street parking.

Let me know if you're interested!

listings.title: Welcome to Higby Where there is no place like home!

listings.description:
Spacious Craftsman Bungalow, a detached single home, not an apartment, walking distance from Ashby BART (.8 mile), and fairly close to Mac Arthur BART (1.3 miles) with many bus lines nearby including a San Francisco bus, this house is close to UC campus (7 minutes by car), and close to CCA (1.4 miles), also close to the Berkeley Bowl, Whole Foods, Temescal shopping district and restaurants, lots of good Ethiopian food (one cafe is a block and a half away), and Nick's Pizza. Parks, tennis courts, community gardens are one block away, and several farmers markets are within walking distance. There is even a bookstore two blocks away. 

On a quiet block with no through traffic, this house has an arched entrance, breakfast nook with great morning light, remodeled light and spacious kitchen with stainless steel appliances- dishwasher and refrigerator, granite kitchen counter tops, a well refurbished vintage gas O'Keefe and Merritt stove with a griddle in the middle, extra deep Kohler sink, new eco-friendly floor and lots of storage. 

19 cubic foot Energy Star rated bottom freezer refrigerator. Extra quiet operation.

Large & sunny living room with a bay window, and a tiled working fireplace with mantle. 

French doors between living room and formal dining room. 

Formal dining room has original built-in buffet, drawers, cabinets, and mirror. 

Two good sized bedrooms. Each bedroom has a large closet. Both bedroom closets have operable windows. The back bedroom windows greet you with fragrant vining jasmine, and pineapple guavas (feijoa) within reach. 

Bathroom has a large and deep bathtub with shower (great water pressure), a sizable linen closet, and a custom Pozzi-Ginori toilet. The bathroom has its original tile floor. 

Front entrance foyer has a large closet, and archways into the living room and front bedroom.

Small front porch. This area is planted with fragrant Cecil Brunner climbing roses arboring the front entrance to the house. 

Laundry and storage in basement. Energy efficient front loading large capacity washer and dryer. 

Hardwood floors throughout recently refinished.

One off street parking space. Lots of parking on street. 

EV charging: Dedicated circuit with 120 volt and 240 volt outlets next to driveway parking space for electric car charging.

Back Patio with planter boxes. 

Gardening space available to renters if desired. The property is landscaped for butterflies, hummingbirds, and fragrance. There is a kitchen herb garden for fresh spices. The property is landscaped with fruit trees: Italian and Meyer lemons, pomegranate, persimmon, orange, lime, and pineapple guavas.

Custom Shou Sugi Ban planter boxes and gate.

Wired for dsl, cable, and Direct tv, and land line. 

Security: The house is equipped with Medeco locks that are unbumpable and unpickable, and a burglar alarm.

Walk Score: 79 very walkable, Bike Score 97 a biker's paradise, Transit Score 63 good transit, Crime Grade A-safer neighborhood.

Quick access to Highways 24, 580, 13, and 80.

Within the Peralta Elementary School enrollment zone.

Tenant pays for water/EBMUD and PGE. Owner pays for garbage. 

Recently painted interior.

This California Craftsman Bungalow has been well maintained; its original details and thoughtful ergonomic design well preserved. This is the only property I rent, and I take pride in keeping it in good shape, responding to tenant requests quickly and respectfully. I initiate most requested repairs on the same day. I am happy to offer this well cared for house to be a really great home for you.

Pet deposit required.

A recent credit report with a FICO score, proof of income, and a completed application will speed up the application process. I can email you an application, or you can get one at a showing.
Acceptable applicants will have: 1) good rental references; 2) positive credit score (720 or better)

Open house dates and times:
Monday, April 11 noon-2pm
Tuesday, April 12 4-7pm
Wednesday, April 13 2-5pm
Individual showings available at other times. Please inquire.

Move in date: now through May 1.

listings.description:
This is a Berkeley style home in Richmond. It's 2 bedrooms, one bath, living room, dining room, kitchen, laundry. 

Hardwood floors. 

Ceramic tile floors in the kitchen and bath. 

Includes a washer and dryer, stove, refrigerator, built in dish washer .... even cute curtains everywhere.

Everything is fresh and clean and ready for a new tenant. 

There is also a large and private yard in the back with a good size deck and a raised vegetable planter. 

And a HUGE basement area at street level with a concrete floor. It's actually bigger than the interior of the entire house upstairs (over 900 square feet). Great for a hobby shop or unlimited storage, etc. The last tenant used it as an art studio and loved having all that space to work in. 

It's located at 1627 Roosevelt Ave. (between 16th and 17th). Good long term neighbors on this block. The house itself is very safe and secure. Walk to Bart and close to Kaiser. Drive by and take a look, then shoot me an email if you have any questions. 

This a really nice place, so I'm looking for a responsible tenant who appreciates neat and clean. If you're looking for a place to call home, a HOUSE and not an apartment, this might be for you! 

Rent is 1755.00 per month (includes garbage)
Deposit is 1755.00 
Tenant pays utilities.
Sorry, no Section 8 

Available to move in on May 1st or sooner. 
Email for more information or to set up a time to view inside.

Thanks, and good luck to all of you!

The Condo: Condominium Resort-like setting, this 700 sq ft. 1-bedroom has minimal neighbor units that surround this particular condo, which makes it quiet and private. It includes a corner-style balcony and more windows than many of the 1-bdrm units at the Watergate. It has a galley style kitchen and large living room area that is great for entertaining guests or to simply have the comfort of a large main central common area. It includes 2 large closets (1 in the bdrm and another in the hallway) and an average sized closet at the entrance of the door.

NEW Upgrades: New floors, New Painted Walls, New Refrigerator, New Stove, New Dishwasher, New Kitchen Cabinets, New Kitchen Counter, New Kitchen Backsplash, New Kitchen Light, New Bathroom Tile, New Bathroom Tub Surrounding, New Bathroom Vanity, New Bathroom Lights, New Faucets, New Hall Light, and more. . . Be the 1st to live in a home filled with all of these brand new appliances and upgrades! 

Location/Commute: The property of the Watergate Condominiums is tucked away in a quiet and very safe area that is surrounded by amazing views (including the Bay Bridge and Golden Gate Bridge). It is walking distance to the Emeryville Marina, close to I-80 and I-580, 1 block away to catch the Casual Carpool to San Francisco and the Free Emery-Go-Round Shuttle (www.emerygoround.org) to local Emeryville shops/stores/movie theater and BART station. Walkers, joggers and bikers take advantage of the sidewalk/biking lane paths to the Emeryville Marina that connects to a walk/jog/bike path that goes to the Berkeley Marina and the city of Albany. 

Watergate Resort-like Amenities: Fitness Center/Gym (with free weights & machines), 4 Swimming pools, 2 hot tubs, 2 sauna's (steam & dry), 4 Tennis Courts, 3 Pool Tables, Racquet Ball Court, Table Tennis tables, on-site laundry, 24-hour Security and UPS & FedEx delivery at the Clipper Club (Watergate's clubhouse) when you're away from home. Nearby stores/restaurants (walking distance) include: The Watergate Market, Subway, Trader Vic's, Chevy's, Trader Joe's, Starbucks & Jamba Juice. 

See Photos: www.watergatecommunityassociation.com/photos.html

Additional Free Perks: Free covered parking for 1 car (that you can see from the condo), Free storage room, Free utilities (Water, Garbage & Sewage only), Free Comcast Cable. Also, can include a Microwave if you need one. 

Pets: Cats are welcomed (2 limit). No additional pet deposit needed.

listings.description:
Premier living in Richmond's Hilltop district 

San Marcos Apartments in Richmond, California offers convenience so you can focus on fun. Park your vehicle in the comfort of your own private garage, then head inside and spend an evening cozying up next to the fireplace. Whatever your ideal furniture arrangement might be, we offer numerous floor plans in our one- and two-bedroom apartments that are sure to complement your interior design savvy. Controlled, gated access and night patrol means you sleep soundly, and our on-site maintenance team is available 24/7 for all of those "Uh-oh!" moments. Feeling stressed? Take advantage of our fitness center and sports courts for that calorie burn, or stroll down beautifully manicured pathways with your pooch to get some fresh air (yes, of course, these Richmond apartments are pet friendly).

Our location in Richmond's Hilltop neighborhood puts you near tons of great places to shop and dine. Head to the Vista del Mar Village Shopping Center to pick up a latte at Starbucks, or shop to your heart's content at the Hilltop Mall, home to staples like Macy's and JC Penny as well as a Wal-Mart. Fresh air abounds at nearby Hilltop Lake Park, and we are also minutes away from the Richmond Country Club and Pointe Pinole Regional Shoreline. Need to get out of Richmond? Hop on I-80 for an easy drive to other cities in the Bay Area. If you don't feel like wasting gas, we are also near bus lines and a few miles from the Richmond Transit Station.

Life should be enjoyed, and here at San Marcos Apartments you will have plenty of opportunity to do just that.

like to support local business/art-craft people/restaurants/farmers markets/co-cops.

listings.description:
Renters are facing really difficult times right now with very high rent, crazy security deposits, no pets being accepted and landlords want you to have perfect credit and income 3 times or 4 higher than the rent just to allow you to rent their house and pay it off for them. Then they want to increase the rent every time the lease it up and in many cases ask you to move so they can sell the house or move back into it. 

We can send you all of the program information in writing just by sending a request. it includes all of our licensing information. Most people qualify when they have a 620 or higher credit score and can document your income. We get so many people who worry this is a scam but everything we provide you is verifiable through multiple governmental sources.

I have sold homes from Berkeley to Discovery Bay for 27 years. I have managed special financing programs provided by the State and Federal Government that encourage renters to become home owners by providing financing options that don't require perfect credit and in most cases cost less to get into than a rental these days. The financing is 30 year fixed rate and includes property taxes, and all the insurance. Simply put, people who bought homes 15 years ago are still paying the same payment they had originally and you will have the same payment 15 years after you buy the house. Landlords will obviously not be keeping the rent at the same level.

In addition there are tax benefits that you get as a homeowner that help most people save thousands per year in Income Tax. This is the part where many people start to think this is a scam or baloney in general. To help with that we offer two things. I am going to give you ways to confirm the information. In addition I can send you an e mail that has both detailed breakdowns on the programs as well as an e mail that has the properties available with pictures and details. 

The programs that we utilize are FHA, VA, USDA Guaranteed, we also use CHDAP California Housing Down Payment Assistance Program, and CHFA California Housing Finance Agency. These last two programs are state based and provide almost 100% of the down payment you need for the FHA Loan. USDA and VA don't require any down payment. 

This is just 1 of the homes that are available in San Leandro, Hayward, San Lorenzo and Oakland. THERE IS AN E MAIL LIST AVAILABLE THAT GIVES YOU ALL THE DETAILS OF THE PROGRAM AND THE INSTRUCTIONS TO GET QUALIFIED AS WELL AS PICTURES AND DETAILS OF ALL THE HOUSES. PLEASE TEXT OR E MAIL THE REQUEST WITH YOUR E MAIL ADDRESS SO I CAN SEND THESE TO YOU.

This home in San Leandro is 4 bedrooms 2 bathrooms and 1750 square feet. It has a 1 car attached garage and this is all on a lot that is almost 4,000 square feet. 

There are 50 homes available from $2175-$3400 and the homes are 760-2200 square feet with 1-5 bedrooms. There are also Condominiums and Townhomes that have payments ranging from $1625-$2720 per month with 1-4 bedrooms and 680-1700 square feet. These properties will have a separate Home Owners Association due per month of $200-$430 per month. 

The cost to move into one of the homes will typically be $3,000-$5,000. Your first payment will not be due until 30 days after you move in.

To qualify you must have at least
1. A credit score of 620 or higher (credit karma is a place to check if you aren't sure of your credit score)
2. You will need to prove your income with the last 30 days paystubs and the last 2 years tax returns
3. No Bankruptcy in the last 2 years
4. No Short Sale, or Foreclosure in the last 3 years.

Licensed by the California Department of Real Estate Eric Wexelman

listings.description:
Shown by appointment. Please respond to this post to set up a time.

This approx. 1601-square-foot live/work artist's loft is located in the historic Clawson School built in 1917. The pride of Oakland's school system for 52 years, this grand building features art deco brick-and-molded-terracotta facade detail rare to find in a residential setting. This ground-floor loft features high ceilings throughout with upgraded architectural design features like a raised bamboo floor, corrugated aluminum siding in spots and a flowing waterfall which can give a zen-like feel and sound, among others. With its large double-paned windows and the beautiful daytime natural light creates the perfect atmosphere for a creative tenant. The very large main space includes an ample, well-equipped kitchen and dining area. The large bathroom has a shower/tub combo, washer and dryer. 

Create your own living layout in this spacious unit that is plenty large enough for a couple. No one is living below, above or around you in the large main space, which gives you the freedom to work late, make noise or watch movies at any hour of the night, making this a truly unique environment. There is simply nothing like it on the market now. Right above, a virtually private deck enables you to sit or barbecue outdoors. There are windows on three sides that allow a sweet marine bay cross-breeze if opened, never getting too hot in summer. Just outside, apple, peach and Asian pears produce fruit in season and lemon trees offer their bounty year-round. There are three common area outside decks that can be used by anyone. This unit has tons of soul and emits creative energy from the solid concrete that housed young children learning and at play for 60 years! They can't build buildings like this anymore. 

The 28-unit building houses an artist/young professional community and the unit itself was previously occupied by a renown artist. Looking for a tenant who loves this space, is responsible, and will enjoy being part of this vibrant community.

Includes:
- water, garbage and sewer 
- washer and dryer in unit
- brand new stainless steel refrigerator
- microwave oven
- brand new semi-pro gas range and oven
- Bosch "quiet" dishwasher
- Cuisinart coffee machine
- garbage disposal
- central gas heating
- double-paned windows
- dehumidifier
- one convenient secure parking space in back lot
- additional parking in front lot
- large closet
- gate clicker
- pest control
- running water fall 
- ceiling fan
- IKEA wardrobe x4

Pets are negotiable. . .

Location:
- 3240 Peralta St. Unit #1
- access to I-80, I-580, CA-24 I-880 and the Bay bridge are just blocks away.
- a few blocks from major shopping: Home Depot, Ikea, Target, Best Buy, AMC, 
Emery Bay Mall, Safeway, Trader Joe's, Starbucks, etc.
- on Emeryville-West Oakland border - a few blocks from the Pixar campus
- minutes from West Oakland Bart and SF is 12 minutes away from there

Terms:
- Available April 1st, 2016
- 1 year lease
- Rent = monthly @ $3640
- Security deposit $4500
- No cigarette smoking
- Renter's insurance required
- No sublets
- Must follow WCL HOA CC&Rs and Rules
- $100 move in/out fee.
- $25 application fee

Please reply to this post if you would like to see this listing and make an appointment to see it or have questions. The $25 application fee will be waived if a current credit report (within 2 weeks) is provided by applicants. 


Some more info on history of the building:
In 1971, Clawson was the center of Superintendent Marcus Foster's partnership with UC Berkeley working to improve education for low-income students. In the mid-1970's, the building became Oakland's foray into creating a public school dedicated to the arts. Dogtown Developers purchased the building from Oakland Unified School District in 1999, after it closed in 1979, and renovated it to create these unique and amazing live/work lofts.

June 1 -- Aug 15 flex (NO shorter lease), with some flexibility at either end. The monthly $2400 rent includes phone (unlimited long distance), DSL, basic utilities charges. 

Despite its size, house OCCUPANCY IS LIMITED TO 3 PEOPLE (children 10 years or older) by owners to keep overall usage of the house to a relatively light level. NO PETS ARE ALLOWED, either outside or inside the house. Although the house is clean, the number of Persian rugs in it does not make it an optimal living space for those who are asthmatic. 

Rent is kept low in recognition that tenants will be expected to water the garden when and where necessary, as well as forward mail.

This spacious (2200+sq ft), private, Mediterranean stucco house is surrounded by woods, with an outdoor dining deck beneath a grape arbor (the picture with the table shaded by umbrella was taken before the umbrella was replaced by the arbor), looking out towards the Golden Gate through the trees, with fruit trees, a sunny backyard, bay views, and a grand piano for the musically inclined. It is about a mile downhill to the UC campus and downtown Berkeley, and within walking distance to bus stops. 

There is an 18 step access down to the house, and no wheelchair accessibility. The house includes:

* Bedrooms: 1 master, 1 inlaw unit w. separate entrance, 1 loft bedroom.
* A small office (inlaw unit also has an office area).
* A dining room and large living room with scenic windows and grand piano.
* Library with woodstove.
* Modern kitchen with dishwasher.
* Laundry nook with washer and dryer. 
* Private cement slab for streetside parking.

listings.description:
This is a brand new (never occupied) apartment that we built in the basement level of our historic 1905 house. The apartment has oak floors throughout. A large living/dining room opens onto the kitchen. There is also a generously sized bedroom and bathroom, as well as abundant closet space. The total size is more than 700 square feet. There is some additional storage space available in the basement. 

The apartment has its own full-sized front-loading washer and dryer. It has radiant floor heat which is included in the rent. Also included are all utilities: gas, electric, water, sewer, trash, and high-speed cable internet & wifi. 

The apartment has its own entry door. A wood gate on Cherry Street and brick path leads through the landscaped garden to the entry door. 

The house is on the corner of Russell St and Cherry Street, one block from College Avenue. It is steps from the Elmwood Cafe, Nabolom Bakery, and many other shops and restaurants. Walk score 92 (Walker's Paradise) and Bike score 94 (Biker's Paradise). 

Street parking is fairly easy within one block. You can obtain a permit from the City of Berkeley for $55/year.

We live upstairs. We are a family of three, including a 5-year old boy. Come be our neighbors!

Available mid-April. Two bedrooms, one bath Elmwood apartment. Very light apartment. New carpeting. Fresh paint. Each bedroom has bed, chest of drawers, desk + chair and armchair. Living/dining room has 2 couches, side table, bookshelf, new table and 4 chairs. Kitchen has dishes, glasses, silverware, blender, food processor, microwave and more. Bathroom has shower: no tub.
Elmwood is one of the nicer Berkeley neighborhoods. It is a quiet and boasts many beautiful houses. The apartment is walking distance to Elmwood shopping area, live theater and movie theater, public park and library. Around the corner from laundromat, coffee shop and major bus line. You can walk, ride bike, take public transit to University of California, BART (Bay Area RapidTransit), Telegraph Avenue, Rockridge or downtown shopping, and more. Shopping areas include restaurants featuring foods from around the world, clothing/jewelry stores, bakeries, ice cream shops, pharmacies, grocery stores and more.

The photos didn't appear in the order I posted them. The picture of the larger bed with red cover goes with the very last photo of dressers and painting. The photo of narrower bed goes with photo of white dresser, armchair and photo. 

Landlord pays garbage bill. Tenant pays water/sewage and utilities bills. Deposit is $4,500 returned in full upon departure (nothing kept unless you caused damages. Interest is paid to you on the amount of deposit.)

This is a huge one-bedroom apartment on the fourth floor of a five-story building facing the Berkeley Hills in a well lit, quiet neighborhood. The name of the property is Icon at Park (1401 Park Avenue in Emeryville). Inside the apartment is very quiet, you will not hear your neighbors due to solid concrete construction! Here are some the highlights: huge walk-in closet with washer and dryer, large bedroom closet, huge kitchen with granite countertops and nice appliances, separate office area that could be used as a guest bedroom, bathroom has a deep soaking tub, nice balcony for your gas or electric grill, reserved parking spot in the garage, bike storage in the garage, on-site gym. 4.Besides, the apt is very close to the nearby transformation (only 2 min walk to the BART station and the bus station, 5 min walk to campus) . You can go shopping at berkeley bowl for cheap&fresh groceries , or for food at the nearby three shops.

Lovely furnished studio cottage with private large deck, surrounded by trees, in Kensington, 3 blocks from North Berkeley, available for rent June 2. Share hot tub & yard with patio. Recently renovated, full kitchen & bath! Queen bed, dishes, pots & pans, sheets & towels all included, if you like - or not, if you prefer. Small but packed w/ mod cons: WiFi, full stove, large fridge, microwave, washer/dryer, TV, bike possibly available to rent. Bus/BART/great restaurants, market & coffee all walkable, UCB is a 10 minute drive or 15 minute bike ride. No problem parking nearby -- parking within 600ft. is always available. 

Cottage is a studio (1 room plus small kitchen & bath), not very large - size is 260 square foot -- ideal for 1 person, OK for a couple, if you don't mind close quarters. 2 people is the absolute max. No smoking indoors. Sorry, no pets. (Please don't contact me if you have pets or more than 2 people!!)

Rental must be 1 year minimum, 1 year lease required. Rent is $1995/mo., plus $150 for utilities & WiFi March-October, and $50 additional for utilities Nov-Feb. Security deposit is $1995. Good credit history and landlord/character references required.

If you are renting from another country, you can rent it on the AirBnB website - search Google for "AirBnB Garden Cottage, Hot Tub & Deck, Kensington CA". You will pay the rent by credit card, then pay a deposit by mail.

listings.title: Spacious 2 bed 2 bath unit with balcony!

listings.description:
We are a danish 30 year old couple working in Berkeley. We are looking for a serious person or couple to share our 3 bedroom upper duplex in a fantastic house really close to Ashby BART with 25 min to San Francisco. We live walking distance from the famous Berkeley Bowl grocery store and many other outlets, cafes and small boutiques. Ashby station is 1 stop from downtown Berkeley and 2 stops in the other direction from downtown Oakland.

You would rent the master bedroom and we would all share living room, kitchen/dining room, outdoor balcony and garden. We dont want to live more than 4 people in this huge 3 bedroom apt, which makes it very spacious and allow privacy. 

The fantastic balcony is very sunny and shared only with our unit and the backyard garden is shared with the lower unit if you want to grow your own vegetables..

We are easy going and only expect you to follow basic housekeeping and noise rules. 

It is a non-smoking unit and we dont want any animals.

The lease is for 1 year and we are asking for 1 months rent in deposit. If you are serious about this place, please get in contact for a showing and more details about us and the place.

listings.description:
AVAILABLE JUNE 1 2016
Introvert's dream, walkers paradise!!!!!! 
4 bedrooms total, 1 full bath, and 1 outdoor shower. Max 5 occupants. 

ONE SINGLE ROOM LEFT $1,350
ONE DOUBLE ROOM LEFT $1,500 ($750 each)
Both available for the summer (or perhaps potentially longer). Minimum lease is one semester.

***** If you contacted us last week, please reach out again! We were out of town, and cannot respond to messages from expired texts! ***** Specifically, Chico's human, we would love to hear from you again! *****
CURRENT COMMUNITY
We are: a Deaf Studies Major from CSUN who is home holidays/summers only and 2 out-of-state undergrads doing summer internships at UCB. This is a co-ed space.

Quirky,central, updated upstairs flat of a circa 1893 Victorian. Owners (my parents) live downstairs. The flat is .5 blocks from Berkeley Bowl, Walgreens, 3 blocks to Ashby BART, and .9 miles to the UCB Campus and shuttle hub for LBNL. The 18 will take you right to the shuttle hubs downtown, and the F will take you all the way up the hill to Stanley Hall. Great alternative to pricey San Francisco and Mountain View. Silicon Valley commuter buses right at Ashby BART station, a 7 minute walk. 

All the furniture and household items you could need. Beds, couches, most of your bedding and linens, even. Fully outfitted kitchen. ALL UTILITIES including Xtreme250 high speed internet, water, electricity, and heat. 4 bedrooms, 1+ bath (including an amazing outdoor shower), galley kitchen, living/dining room. Hang out spaces inside and out, couches, great internet. ******Weekly cleaning of common spaces.***** Fully tricked out kitchen. You won't need anything to move in but yourself and your books. Landlords replace stuff as needed, which is awesome.


W/D in unit. Gorgeous outdoor shower with changing room. Shared, big back yard with a pergola and patio. There is room for safe outside bike storage, and some space if you like to garden. Key-less entry.

Amazing! Location, location, location.
---> 20 minutes to SF
---> 10 minutes to Oakland
---> 10 minutes to UCB
---> 7 minutes to Silicon Valley Commuter Buses

This is the *perfect* car-free location, with a Walkscore of 98. Literally steps away from everything: grocery store, drug store, bus stops, BART, parks, restaurants, etc. Served by AC Transit 18, 49, and F, plus the Ashby BART station. GREAT LIGHT with southern and western exposure. Silicon valley commuter buses right at Ashby BART station.


We are serious about maintaining occupancy rule and quiet hours. Off street parking available, but not always right by the house. Can be loud due to street noise.


We have "loud hours" instead of quiet hours, and our loud hours are 8am to 10pm on work-nights, and 10am to 1am on off-nights. We use the UCB calendar for what is an "off-night". Laundry is $5/load to shared cookie jar that pays for detergent and water. Requests and disputes of all kinds run through a designated moderator. Every room has its own deadbolt lock. By appointment only because our schedules are too complicated to explain here. Pets on case by case basis. We cannot add the link to this post because of TOS.
 Looking forward to meeting you!


Contact us to learn more, see our community norms docs, or set up a time to see the apartment.

listings.description:
Link to Mandatory online questionnaire (Only nine questions in total; mostly true/false):
https://ah5.typeform.com/to/g8cX6v

Welcome to your furnished stand-alone personal studio suite! The hardwood floor suite has more-than 250 square feet of living space that is completely yours, where you have absolute privacy. Suite has separate entrance; you come and go as you please. 

It is roomy, sunny and well-ventilated; dimensions of the main room (excluding the balcony and the bathroom) are 12' x 14'. Suite has private bathroom with high-pressure shower. Wood floors have been recently refinished. 

It is located by Shattuck/Dwight at indicated on the map. It is central to everything! In downtown Berkeley, the studio is close to the University of California, Berkeley campus, and also 7-ish min walk (depends on pace) away from BART station, which will get you to downtown San Francisco in 22 minutes!

. For your comfort, it features a newer Queen-size Serta Perfect Sleeper premium bed with brand-new boxspring and brand-new frame. It comes with an indoor table, chair, patio table, patio chair, kitchen nook appliances, and more! CONTROL the temperature, you have your own in-unit personal touchscreen wall heater with digital thermostat.



You can also smoke on your private balcony (subject to local laws of course)

There is no full kitchen, but you do have a kitchenette nook with personal refrigerator, brand-new microwave, and brand-new coffee maker! I live in the adjacent apartment, Only connection to the rest of the apartment is a solid extra-thick door with 2 locks, including a deadbolt lock that you control on your side. Neither side (yours or mine) are a shared spaces for the other party.

Note that the building is from 1950s and, since this is Berkeley, the owner have not done any renovations whatsoever on it. Elevator appears to be original to building (old).
Apartment has in-building laundry, as well as available covered parking garage for extra.

Given the connecting door, I am looking for someone who is be reasonably courteous with respect to noise. You don't need to whisper, but you shouldn't shout either, Especially close by the locked connecting door. (Although solid and extra-thick, a door always transmits more noise than walls.) Please use headphones while listening to multimedia/shows on your computer, try to have loud conversations on the phone on the balcony, etc. (i would of course reciprocate the courtesy.)

Rent is $1475 per month. This includes water, gas. Everything but the electricity and the wireless Internet, for which we would split the bill evenly between us.


i'm open about the race, sex, gender, or orientation. Due to lease occupancy limits, no couples please. Mutual respect and courtesy are the most important things. You would sign a lease for 6 months, with security deposit equal to one month's rent afterwards, the term will be month by month. The landlord requires new roommates to fill out a form, with references, employment salary verification, and a credit check. There will be a $35 fee assessed by the landlord to process the rental application.

-------------------------------------------
Link to MANDATORY online questionnaire (Only nine questions in total; mostly true/false):
https://ah5.typeform.com/to/g8cX6v


Please fill out my online questionnaire in order to come by and see the studio suite. If you do not fill out the questionnaire, I will assume that you are spam and will not respond. 

https://ah5.typeform.com/to/g8cX6v


THE AD WILL REMAIN UP WHILE THE ROOM IS AVAILABLE. First availability to see the studio will be sometime this week during the day or this upcoming Thursday evening.

listings.title: PPP berkeley view apartment

listings.description:
Live in Oakland's Premiere Apartment Community 

Oakland's first and only ultra-luxe apartment community. We are in a prime location in the Lake Merritt District of Oakland. One block from Lake Merritt, and only 3 blocks from the 19th St. BART station. Only moments from fine dining, wine bars, Whole Foods, and Starbucks, this IS your next home!

Come visit us today and see for yourself what sets apart from the rest with our ultra-luxury, ultra-grand apartment homes. On this same 16th floor you will find our sky deck with views of Lake Merritt just steps away from your apartment home!

16th Floor 2 Bedroom Tokyo Apartment 
Available April 16th
$4,584 on a 12 Month Lease 

Don't miss out on such an amazing apartment!

Come check out our Tokyo floor plan with 1192 square feet!

Check us out on our website: http://thegrandapts.com 

As a member of our community, we encourage you to enjoy our sixth floor terrace overlooking Lake Meritt, Grand Ave & even San Francisco. Located on the terrace is our serene spa with patio furniture and Wi-Fi accessibility. Don't miss out of our luxury lounge complete with a Plasma screen, fully equipped kitchen and gas fireplace! Our fitness center is fully outfitted with the latest equipment and is open 24 hours in order to fit into your busy schedule. No need to pay for a gym membership again!! This floor is pet free. The building is pet friendly. 

Spoil yourself with Luxury:
24-hour Fitness center
Business center
Conference room
Community lounge
Concierge Service
24-hour security
Controlled access parking
Landscaped courtyards with free Wi-Fi 
Hydrotherapy Spa 
Non-Smoking Building
Resident Activies
Parking Available at Additional Cost
Please call us at

or email at the

and arrange a tour with one of our leasing team members. For your convenience, we have leasing information available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week!! We look forward to making the GRAND your new home.

We are open 7 days a week and tour from 9:00am to 5:00pm (Monday-Saturday) & 11-3 (Sunday) to help you find your new home.

listings.description:
Spacious backyard cottage, surrounded by trees. Available July 1st. 

Upstairs: Large bedroom and en-suite bathroom. Downstairs: Newly renovated open plan kitchen and living room/study area, good for entertaining. New refrigerator, oven range, in-unit washer/dryer. Partially furnished. One-year Lease. 

One off-street parking space available.

Get in touch and please tell us about yourself and your roommate:
- College year, major, brief bio of who you are.
- How long do you plan to rent the cottage? One year? Two years?
- When are you available to see the cottage?

Please do not disturb current tenants. Showing by appointment.

listings.title: FABULOUS 4 BED/2 BATH IN NORTH BERKELEY HILLS

listings.description:
Library Gardens' Berkeley apartments feature modern appointments including:

-Gourmet Kitchens with Breakfast Bars, Double-Basin Sinks, Garbage Disposals, 
and GE Appliances including Built-in Microwaves, Full-Size Refrigerators, 
and Full-Size Dishwashers
-Pre-wired for Cable, Internet Service, and Multiple Phone Lines in Each Residence
-Spacious Closets with European-Style Shelving
-Lofty 10-Foot Ceilings
-Roommate-Friendly Floor Plans -- Perfect for Students
-Environmentally-Friendly Paint, Adhesives and Carpets for Better Indoor Air Quality

Library Gardens, Berkeley's premier apartment community, features an extensive array of amenities:

-24-Hour Laundry Care Centers on Each Floor 
-Wireless Connection throughout Community 
-Small Dogs and Cats Welcome 
-Bike Racks and Lockers 
-Monthly On-Site Parking Available 
-VIP Parking for Hybrids and Alternative Fuel Vehicles 
-Plentiful Guest Parking 
-Complimentary Package Acceptance Service 
-Copy and Fax Service 
-Private Access Entry 
-Verdant Private Courtyards and Terraces

Library Gardens offers modern, beautiful Berkeley apartments in the heart of vibrant downtown Berkeley:

-One block to UC Berkeley Campus
-One block to public transport (BART, AC Transit)
-Steps to restaurants, cafes, bookstores and shopping
-Over 20 movie screens within 1/2 block, including fine art film venues 
-Adjacent to Berkeley's Public Library, YMCA and the Habitot Children's Museum 

*Prices are subject to change daily
*Furniture is not included only high speed internet,cable and trash

listings.description:
Single story house has 2 bedrooms, 1 full bathroom, family room, dinning room, kitchen nook and upgraded kitchen.
The house is on a lot with a spacious two car garage in the back. It was built in 1928 and is about 1000 sq ft. It is located on University Ave. in Berkeley, about 2 miles from the university. The property is close to I80 and five minutes walk to BART station.
The kitchen has stainless steel Kenmore appliances and modern new cabinets. Black granite countertops. Gas stove and oven. The laundry room is in an adjacent outside room next to the house, right off the backdoor and has Kenmore washer and dryer (electrical). 
There are maple color laminate floors through out the house. In the kitchen and bathroom there is tile. AC/Heater unit. 
No smoking in the house.
Ready to move in now 041516 
Deposit: $2000.00 
Rent: $3000.00 
Call for a visit at:

listings.description:
Open 7 days a week! Call us today or stop by for a tour, we accept walk-ins. 

You can view Apartment #225 floor plan online at www.livehigby.com

Everything you need is found downstairs or right down the street -- groceries, cafes, local drug store, San Pablo Park, even public transportation is just steps away from home. Higby Apartments embraces apartment homes as unique as its surroundings. Each floorplan has its own character with extraordinary large double pane windows that start from the ground up and your very own spacious laundry rooms in selected units. All homes are fully equipped with energy efficient dishwasher, and full size washer & dryer. Come experience the vibrancy and Culture of Berkeley-- come experience Higby.


*Equal Housing Opportunity*
listings.title: Spacious 2 bed 2 bath with Just steps away from Berkeley bowl!

listings.description:
For rent is a spacious 1 bedroom garden apartment in N. Berkeley. 

This unit is ideal for a single occupant or a couple, though its layout also works for use as a two bedroom using a room divider (2 occupants max). 

The kitchen is well equipped and all appliances are in excellent condition - it has a gas stove, dishwasher, fridge, granite countertops, sink with detachable hose, and lots of cabinets. The bedroom has a walk-in closet and carpet.

There's a beautiful garden outside your door, and this unit has its own patio as well as a shared outdoor seating area. Coin operated laundry is on site.

The location is highly convenient - very close to Andronico's, Safeway, Cheeseboard and the rest of the Gourmet Ghetto. 15 minute walk or 5 minute bike ride to Downtown Berkeley BART.

Officially available May 1st, but early move-in may be possible. Call the property manager Otis Niles for more information. Phone is better than email.
